Job Title: Marketing Assistant for Autism Life Coaching Practice
Description:
This virtual part-time position’s primary focus is to support the marketing function of an autism life coaching practice. This position reports directly to the founder. The work can be done any time, up to 10 hours per week, as long as deadlines are met. Must have a reliable computer and be able to meet over Zoom once a week during the morning hours of the U.S. Mountain Time Zone (GMT-6).

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Note: You must also have 2-3 references who can speak about your success doing similar work.

Using well-defined steps and instructions, you will: 

- Post and schedule pre-written blog posts to the weekly blog in the Wix platform.
- Prepare weekly newsletter for delivery
- Create and execute a social media plan that includes at least three social media posts per week, including one that promotes the new blog post and one video-based post. 
- Post social media posts to the following channels using ContentStudio: Instagram, Facebook company page, Two private Facebook groups, LinkedIn, Twitter
- Actively manage posts that fail
- Here are the detailed instructions. Please review this and make sure this is something you want to do: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DWrJtxdpkg2lL_yJktUJhyDKAASJJ4GsexuijW5umuA/edit?usp=sharing

SKILLS AND ABILITIES
- Exceptional attention to details
- Exceptional organization skills
- Can learn new software platforms quickly – tech-savvy
- Ability to work independently and proactively keep founder apprised of work progress
- Strong written communication skills in English (ability to recognize and fix typos in the English language in blog posts and social media posts)
- Will ask good questions when the instructions are not clear
- Can meet your own deadlines as well as manage expectations in advance when deadlines may be missed
- Can proactively let the founder know if she is falling behind on deadlines related to blog posts or social media creation/approval
- Commitment to excellent work product
- Basic graphic design skills in creating beautiful on-brand social media posts
- Ability to create video-based social media posts
- Ability to come up with ideas for video-based social media posts
- Mastery of Google Mail, Drive, Docs, Sheets, Calendar, and Zoom

IF YOU HAVE ANY OF THE FOLLOWING, IT’S A PLUS!
- Experience with Wix or WordPress
- Experience with ContentStudio or other social media management platforms
- Experience with Canva, PhotoShop or other graphic design software
- Experience with ContentStudio or other social media management platform 
- Experience or interest in growing into a bigger role based on your skills and interests

WHAT I DO
Neurodivergent people experience, interpret, and interact with the world in unique ways that are different, not less. Because the world is not designed for them, daily life is often more difficult due to neurological differences that influence communication, sensory processing, executive functioning, and learning.

Despite their many strengths, they often end up with chronic frustration and an alphabet soup of diagnoses that leave them feeling broken. As a life coach to both neurodivergent adults and their parents, I help turn that around through self-understanding, goal setting, and skill building to help them thrive. I’m part teacher, part mentor, part cheerleader, and part accountability partner.

MEET PATTY
I am a coach, educator, author, and speaker on the topic of neurodiversity. I understand the impact of being neurodivergent in a world built for neurotypicals. I come from the neurodiversity perspective, and I also acknowledge the challenges differences can pose to daily living.

In my coaching practice, I am an autism life skills and parent coach with both personal and professional experience with neurodiversity. I help autistic teens, adults, and their parents develop understanding, set and achieve goals, acquire skills, and ultimately thrive. I provide coaching sessions via Zoom with clients worldwide.

Every neurodivergent person possesses a unique set of strengths and weaknesses. We collaborate to identify their top goals and figure out which strengths can be leveraged while also identifying and overcoming any barriers that may be in the way of reaching their goals. Each coaching plan I develop is as personalized as my clients are unique.

My mission is to empower my clients to become their own best coaches and coach myself out of a job. To learn more about me, you can find my LinkedIn profile here.

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS
If you’d like to be considered for this role, please fill out the survey here: https://forms.gle/AR9nn2b6f9x52f2E7. Top applicants will be invited to create a demo video-based social media post and do a Zoom interview.

About chitchatsale.com: 
eCommerce today still counts less than 15% of the total retail market due to numerical challenges. The biggest one is the lack of trust. Many consumers have experienced fake online products, this is hurting consumer confidence, leading to stagnation in eCommerce growth.

Livestream provides a digitalized brick-and-mortar experience, real-time customer engagement, thus, compelling online shopping experience. Livestream allows customers to view the products before placing orders, therefore, increase conversion rates.

Chitchatsale.com is the first integrated livestream eCommerce platform. It also is the first to introduce a group-buying function to help online consumers save money. The platform is further divided into multiple sub-websites to suit unique needs of different industries and further improves online shopping experience and quality.

Description
LowCode Agency is a leading no-code and low-code software development agency that works with clients to build cutting-edge, custom software solutions. We are on the lookout for an experienced Sales Development Representative (SDR) to help us grow our business through cold acquisition.

The ideal candidate should be an expert at copywriting, cold outreach, and setting up email campaigns and sequences. You should have a passion for closing deals and be comfortable with A/B testing and iterating your approach to maximize conversions. As an SDR at LowCode, your job will be to find and target new leads, build relationships with possible clients, and help close deals.

This is a full time, contractor based position, and we're looking for someone who can work normal work hours, Eastern Time. There's a nominal fixed fee ($500-$1,000 USD, based on experience and willingness to jump on the phone with clients or not) + a very attractive bonus/commission based plan. You should be making over 2k/mo in no time and 4-5k in 6 months.

Responsibilities
Understand our market and customer personas and create successful email cold campaigns.
Conduct outbound emails to potential clients to establish a relationship and assess their needs
Craft persuasive and engaging copy for emails, landing pages, and other outreach materials
Develop email campaigns and sequences that drive engagement and maximize conversions
Analyze data and metrics to optimize outreach efforts and improve overall effectiveness
Work closely with the sales team to develop and implement new sales strategies and tactics
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in sales and marketing

Qualifications
Proven track record of success in cold sales, with at least 1 year of experience in a similar role. We expect you to have experience sending dozens of email sequences and thousands of emails per month (using automation tools)
Proven Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to craft compelling copy
Strong understanding of A/B testing and data-driven marketing strategies
Experience with sales automation tools, email warmers, CRM's.
Self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail
You love spending time in Apollo, creating contact lists, researching leads, using AI and manually enhancing data, creating converting copy, and following up A LOT with your leads

Interested? 
Apply to this job. Send proof of the cold campaigns that you've worked on. Share one that worked, and one that didn't, and mention why. If you're really interested, send a loom.com (or similar) video of why you want this job and what you would do if we hired you tomorrow.

About LowCode Agency
We're a leading no/low code software development agency. We have an amazing and tight-knit team of 14 ppl who are the best at what we do, and enjoy building cool stuff.

Job Title: Cold Calling For Local News Publication in San Francisco
Description:
We are looking for a Cold Calling Professional to assist our team. As a Cold Calling Professional, you will be responsible for contacting potential advertising and lead generation clients to introduce them to our local news publication and our business directory services. Your goal is to schedule follow-up phone calls with these contacts for our sales team and ultimately secure new business relationships. 

Responsibilities:

 -Make cold calls and use consultative sales techniques to introduce our publication and services, explain its benefits, and set up appointments with prospective clients for our sales team  

 -Track all leads generated through cold calling efforts in the company CRM system  

 -Follow up on leads when necessary via email or phone call  

 -Ensure that all contacts within an account are engaged throughout the sales process  

 -Provide feedback on market trends/competitive intelligence gathered during cold calls   
 
Requirements:

 -Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

Description:
Looking for a Facebook Ad Specialist to develop and execute ad campaigns for my roofing clients. I will pay $600 per month, for each client that you service.

I'm looking for someone who is a marketing expert in the roofing niche and has proof of great results! If this sounds like you apply and we'll jump on a call.  No agencies or white label agencies.

Do you get distracted when you spot a typo in a book? Do you strive for perfectionism? If you answered yes and are interested in ongoing work, then this position is perfect for you! Work tends to revolve around daily deadlines (by COB) for various short projects.

Scheduling is flexible! We'd like someone M-F between a window of 6am-11pm EST. 

Highest priority given to those able to sign on afternoons and/or early mornings. Whatever times you are available, we ask for consistency. Priority is also given to those who can work 3+ hours per day! 

You will be working on reports that have been created for media sales teams, whose goal is to convince potential clients to partner with them for advertising.

Copy editing is not limited to mistakes in spelling, grammar, and punctuation but also consists of photo relevancy, adherence to style guide rules, sourcing, etc.

Tasks:
- Ensure analysts pull correct data (typically confirmed via excel).
- Correct omissions, errors, or inconsistencies found in professionally graphic-designed presentations and infographics created.
- Compare information or figures on one record against data on another record to detect errors.
- Identify and immediately communicate revisions through Slack that must be made.

REQUIRED software:
- Google Chrome
- Microsoft PowerPoint & Excel
- Slack (no familiarity needed—similar to Skype)

If you look like a good candidate, we will follow up with a proofreading test. 

Training will be provided, along with our style guide and other helpful resources to get you acclimated to the work. Pay begins at $11 while in training, and will get bumped up to $13 after. (Training time varies depending on your hours of availability, but on average lasts up to 90 days.)

Job Title: Google Tag Manager / Conversion Architecture Expert needed to work with media agency.
Description:
We are seeking an experienced freelancer to provide conversion architecture expertise for our Media Agency. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring accurate tracking of conversions for our clients. As an agency, we rely heavily on conversion goals, so accuracy is of the utmost importance.

The freelancer will commit to one day per week of regular work to help us set up/troubleshoot conversions for our clients.
The work is varied and will involve different client types. For example, one client might need help getting GA4 and Shopify accurate while another needs to get lead forms tracking from WordPress. Facebook conversions API is also a big one for us.
The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with GTM, data layers, Zapier, Facebook Conversions API and other related tools.

Access is always the most difficult problem to overcome, so the freelancer will be expected to work via a remote desktop linked to our systems that already has all the access you will need.
We are looking for a minimum commitment of one regular day per week where the freelancer is at least contactable for a few hours during Australian business hours (AEDT 8.00am-5pm). We are open to working with freelancers in different timezones, as long as there is overlap during our business hours for facetime with our staff.

We will run a paid test at your profile rate to both make sure it’s a good fit before making a long-term commitment.

When you apply, please propose your cost for a day of work (8 hours)

We are seeking an experienced and creative Brand Manager to join our team. In this role, you will develop, implement, and manage marketing strategies to enhance our brand's image, increase brand awareness, and drive growth. You will work closely with various departments, including marketing, sales, and product development, to ensure a cohesive brand strategy that aligns with company goals and objectives.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement brand strategies to build brand equity and drive long-term growth.
Monitor market trends, analyze competitors, and identify target markets and customer segments to optimize brand positioning.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and execute integrated marketing campaigns that promote brand awareness, increase customer engagement, and drive sales.
Work with product development teams to ensure products align with brand values, messaging, and target audience.
Coordinate with the creative team to develop compelling brand assets, including packaging, promotional materials, and advertising campaigns.
Establish brand guidelines, ensuring consistency across all marketing channels and touchpoints.
Develop and maintain relationships with external partners, such as agencies, influencers, and vendors, to support marketing initiatives and enhance brand visibility.
Analyze brand performance using key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide regular reports to senior management.
Manage brand budget, allocating resources effectively to achieve marketing objectives and maximize return on investment (ROI).
Provide guidance and support to junior team members, fostering a positive work environment that encourages collaboration and innovation.
Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in brand management, marketing, or a related role, with a proven track record of success.
Strong understanding of brand development, consumer insights, and market research methodologies.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex ideas to diverse audiences.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and meet tight deadlines.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
Creative and strategic thinker with a passion for building and nurturing brands.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Adobe Creative Suite, and marketing analytics tools.
Team player with strong leadership and interpersonal skills.
To apply for this position, please submit your resume, a cover letter outlining your relevant experience, and a portfolio showcasing your work.

Looking for a "people person" who will representing a reputable company in reaching out to claimants.  We are needing someone who has experience in sales, customer service or client fulfillment.  We are wanting to work with people who has no quit/good attitude.  We work from 830AM to 530PM PST.  Looking to hire ASAP with full time hours!

Ideal candidate will assist clients with securing The Employee Retention Credit (ERC) for their businesses. ERC is a refundable tax credit for businesses that continued to pay employees while shut down due to the COVID-19 pandemic or had significant declines in gross receipts from March 13, 2020 to Dec. 31, 2021.  

COMPANY OVERVIEW

We are an accounting firm based in CA with a mission to deliver outstanding client service, provide fulfilling careers and professional satisfaction to our people, and achieve financial success so we can reward ourselves and grow.

POSITION OVERVIEW

This position will be an hourly rate.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES


Phone Communication - Speaking with claimants
Appointment Setup - Calling the claimants and setting appointments for the claimants to speak to the asset recovery specialist.
Skip Tracing - finding claimants through skip tracing tools.

QUALIFICATIONS

Good with email and call communication.
Advanced English Speaking Skills
Never Give up attitude.
Highly Organized.
Can work in the Pacific Timezone

PROFICIENCIES

Organizational Skills: This role requires high levels of organization, as documents need to be filed in a way that makes it easy for them to be found later. The Case Manager will have effective planning as these qualities are vital in this role.

Basic Computer Skills: The Case Manager will need great typing skills and be able to pick up software and programs quickly, including Microsoft Office products, SharePoint and Monday.com

Attention to Detail: The Case Manager won’t let little details escape them, working with a high level of accuracy.

Quality Communication: The Case Manager must be an excellent communicator, in both written and oral forms. This includes high proficiency in spelling, grammar, and punctuation. You must also be able to track communication (and be very responsive) across multiple channels without losing any details. Those channels could include in-person meetings, virtual video calls, MS Teams messages, and/or emails.

High Level of Discretion: Since this role works with confidential data and information, the skip tracer caller specialist must be dependable, trustworthy, and has the integrity as they exercise discretion and sensitivity regarding financial information.

Team Player: The Case Manager will need to be able to collaborate and communicate well with their team members, maintaining a can-do spirit and not complaining, making excuses, or gossiping.

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS
If this list of qualifications describes you, please submit a cover letter and proposal including your resume via Upwork.

Job Title: WANTED: Appointment Setter Superstar -  LinkedIn / Cold Calls / Cold Emails
Description:
Hi we are a marketing agency specializing in the legal sector - personal injury niche.

We are looking for someone to help us set appointments with personal injury attorneys  in the US.

We are an innovative fintech startup, offering a new, disruptive budgeting app. We need a highly skilled, tech-savvy social media manager who is super personable with great communication skills to connect with millennial/gen-z target customers. 

This is a part time job, starting with 5 hours per week with the possibility of 20-30 hours in April/May, 2023. You will solely create and manage the entire social media presence of the company.

Who We Are
BAMF, we are a content marketing and lead generation agency specializing in helping entrepreneurs grow and leverage their personal brands to drive results and impact the world. We work with A-list entrepreneurs, small business owners, and startup founders alike, bringing them over half a billion organic content impressions and millions in revenue. 

What You’ll Work On
Our Account Managers are critical to our success as the liaisons between the agency and its clients. They are the primary point of contact for clients-- handling all day-to-day client interactions, as well as managing the campaigns, including coordinating the internal team and deadlines, needed to foster client success. They ensure each client receives exceptional results and impeccable service.

As an Account Manager you are simultaneously an agency representative, project manager, and client coach. To be successful, you’ll need strong organizational, time-management, editing and interpersonal skills. You must thrive in a fast-paced environment, and be comfortable making decisions without direct supervision. 

Here are some specifics:
1. New client onboarding: including kickoff calls with clients, content interviews, and campaign setup.

2. Overseeing the implementation of LinkedIn marketing campaigns: Ensuring that all aspects of the campaign are executed effectively and efficiently. This includes tracking performance, analyzing data, and making adjustments as needed to improve campaign results.

3. Building relationships with clients: A crucial part of the job of Account Manager is building strong relationships with clients. The Account Manager works closely with clients to understand their needs and goals, and provide ongoing support and guidance to ensure clients concerns are responded to and they are satisfied with our services.

4. Collaborating with other teams: The Account Manager must work effectively with other teams within the company to ensure a cohesive and effective campaign and the retention of clients. Good communication and collaboration skills are essential for success in this role.

5. Campaign data analysis: A significant part of the job is tracking the performance of campaigns and analyzing data to understand what's working and what's not. The Account Manager is responsible for reviewing reports on campaign performance, and working with the team and clients to drive improvements.

6. Optimizing campaigns: The Account Manager is responsible for continuously monitoring and optimizing digital marketing campaigns to ensure that they deliver the best possible results. This includes making recommendations for changes to targeting, messaging, and other campaign elements to improve performance.

This position is remote and will be required to be available during business hours on a daily basis. 

What you bring:

The ideal candidate will have experience in digital marketing and account management and be open to learning about– or be familiar with– LinkedIn and social media in general. Love of business and entrepreneurship would also be a great fit in this role. 

Here are some additional specifics:

• Minimum of 2-3 years account experience within the digital and social advertising space handling multiple clients.
• Excellent communication (both written & oral) and presentation skills in English.
• Solid time management and organizational skills.
• Ability to work effectively and efficiently in a fast-paced environment while handling multiple clients and campaigns simultaneously.
• Ability to maintain and/or develop client relationships.
• Impeccable grammar and editing skills.
• Awareness of digital marketing fundamentals, with an interest to learn more.
• Ability to multitask and prioritize under ever-changing needs and schedules.
• Proven project management skills with an emphasis on quality control.
• Team player -- Collaborate with a small team, ask for help when needed, and delegate tasks.
• Proactive -- you strive to get ahead of a problem and seek assistance before disaster hits.
• Comfortable taking Zoom video calls and recording call with clients
• Previous experience with remote working software preferred, including ClickUp, Slack, Zoom, etc.
• A generally good person. We don't allow any bad apples on our team

Here's what you can expect: 

1. Flexible working hours. 
2. Clear & concise expectations from day 1. 
3. A positive and supportive culture. ALWAYS. 
4. You will not be required to purchase or sign up for any tools on your own. 
5. A flat, consistent salary. 
6. A huge opportunity to grow with the company as we grow (We're aiming to 10x our company by the end of the next year) 

If this sounds like a good fit for you, the next step is a short assignment that we'll share with you when you submit a proposal (basically just sharing a few questions for you to answer via a Loom video). Feel free to reach out with any questions. Let's do this!

Job Title: Looking for a marketing expert to sell online course
Description:
Hello,

I am looking for a marketing expert that can help me sell my online course.

The course is all about branding, meant for entrepreneurs, and in the $500 price range. It is available online and since its launch in 2020 I have done below the minimum in marketing and advertising it (only got 4 students).

I am looking for someone who can help with some (if not all) of the following:
- Review and edit the sales page
- Review the content to ensure the course and landing page deliver on the promises (you will gain free access to the course for this)
- Provide suggestions for pricing, content, and audience changes to make more sales
- Create any and all marketing materials
- Take full control over the marketing aspects (I do not want to be involved in this at all after the initial push)
- Regular status reports and updates (I want to see where my money is going)
- Long-term marketing plans, goals, and outlines

Please note: while I do have Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn accounts, I *do not use them*. If social media is a big part of your marketing plan, please take into consideration that I will not be active on these platforms and that I have a very small following on them. 

In addition, I do have a very small mailing list on FloDesk that is meant for *information purposes only* so I do not market to them. If email marketing is required, that will be starting from 0 subscribers! 

When it comes to budget, I have no idea what to aim for but I will gather the funds required for the right person (the higher the quote, the longer the wait), though I'm hoping we could do long-term marketing on a commission basis after the initial push (percentage negotiable). 

This is not for a sale or special event or anything.

If you're interested in this project, let me know about your experience in marketing online courses and your timeframe, process, the tools you regularly use, and your quote (please include ads spent in your quote).

Thank you,
Kristina

Who we are: Confidos Technologies IT Services and Consulting firm 
Whom we are looking for: BDM (Business Development Manager) for US IT Staffing
Job Locations: Remote or Work from Home
Who we are looking for 
We are seeking a Passionate, Results-oriented, and Innovative Senior Business Development Manager for our New Startup US IT Staffing Division working for the USA market to help us in the company’s growth and will be part of the development of Confidos Technologies. You will be at the front of the company and will have to generate leads and close deals. The goal is to drive sustainable financial growth by boosting sales and forging strong relationships with clients.
We are looking for Senior Business Development Manager (BDM) who can come with their client or preferred vendor where we can work on C2C requirements with them for the startup US consulting firm.
What you will do and your key Responsibilities:

•	As a Business Development Manager for US IT consulting, your main responsibility will be to identify and develop new business opportunities in the field of information technology. 
•	Develop new client accounts (Direct / Tier 1 Partners), should be able to identify/target potential Vendors for IT staffing business in the USA and get contract Staffing Requirements. 
•	Leverage your existing relationships and network to open a new business.
•	Maximize revenue opportunities and ensure business is profitable.
•	You will use your proven network to craft, initiate and implement revenue growth plans and strategies in Staffing Solutions for US-based companies. 
•	Using your experience and proven skill set, develop talent acquisition strategies and grow revenue to achieve assigned targets.
•	You will be responsible for developing and implementing strategies to drive growth, increase revenue and improve profitability.
•	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients and partners to understand their needs and provide solutions.
•	Build a pipeline of enterprise clients across target markets through business development and networking activity.
•	Build long-term relationships with direct clients by meeting their IT Consulting resource needs and contributing to their growth. 
•	Develop and sustain effective new business relationships with accounts/clients and independently handle staffing business.
•	Great understanding of Recruiting IT Professionals for US, Companies.
•	Interact with clients on daily basis and identify staffing opportunities to fulfill.
•	Maintain Client relationship management.

What you need

•	Minimum of 7+ years of experience in IT staffing business development/account management in the US market.
•	Must have prior relationships with Tier-1 Partners / End Clients with a consistent track record of placements with them.
•	Aggressive and Target oriented with the ability to work in a high-pressure environment, multi-tasking, and self-motivated.
•	Self-Starter and able to work in an unstructured environment.
•	Should be able to work Independently work - end to end in pursuing placements/revenue targets.
•	Expert-level technical recruitment skills.
•	Interact daily with Clients, Vendors, management, and internal employees.
•	Expertise in recruiting Citizens, EADs, Green Card Holders, OPT, CPT, and H1B consultants and proficient knowledge in US employment tax terms such as 1099, W2, and Corp to Corp(C2C) placing candidates on contract, contract to hire, and full-time Positions.
Working Conditions: 
•	Willing to work the Night Shifts. 
•	Constant exposure to a computer. 
•	Sitting for extended periods of time. 

Why Confidos

Confidos is an equal opportunity employer where diversity is valued, and all employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need. Come and Let’s together grow your career in the most exciting, fast-paced technology market, with a business that delivers feel-good connections.
WE OFFER A GREAT BENEFITS PACKAGE!
There's so much more to enjoy about being at Confidos Technologies than just having a rewarding career. In addition to offering competitive compensation plans and long-term career opportunities, Confidos provides an attractive mix of benefit plans to contribute to its employees' good health and peace of mind.

We would love to hear from you – Apply now.
Interested candidates can share resumes at Sharath sharath@confidostechnologies.com

Job Title: Social media ad specialist needed for e-commerce businesses
Description:
We are seeking an experienced and creative Social Media Manager to oversee our clients' social media accounts and execute effective social media marketing strategies for e-commerce businesses. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of social media platforms, content creation, and community management. The Social Media Manager will work closely with our clients to develop and implement social media campaigns that align with their business objectives, while also analyzing and reporting on social media performance.

Responsibilities:

Develop and execute social media strategies to drive brand awareness, engagement, and traffic to client websites.
Manage and grow social media accounts across various platforms, including but not limited to Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, and TikTok.
Create and curate compelling content, including graphics, videos, and written copy, that resonates with the target audience and aligns with the brand's voice and tone.
Monitor social media accounts, engage with followers, and respond to comments and messages in a timely and professional manner.
Analyze social media metrics and provide regular reports to clients, highlighting performance, insights, and opportunities for optimization.
Stay up-to-date with social media trends, algorithms, and best practices, and proactively propose new ideas and strategies to clients.

Qualifications:
- 2+ years of experience in social media management, preferably in an agency setting.
- Strong knowledge of social media platforms, including best practices for content creation, community management, and paid social advertising.
- Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills, with the ability to adapt to different brand voices and styles.
- Proficiency in social media management tools, such as Hootsuite, Sprout Social, or Buffer.
- Experience with social media analytics and reporting, including the ability to use data to inform strategy and decision-making.
-Strong organizational and project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
-Positive attitude, collaborative spirit, and a passion for social media marketing.
*Salary is to be discussed on interview*

I need a cold caller for my marketing agency serving local businesses. I have recently launched a company that aims to bring a job marketplace to discord. There are two main actors: Experts(Freelancers) and Clients. And there are two ways a Client can get connected to an Expert.

-Strong understanding of dental services and the dental industry.

-Knowledge of pixel, meta, Google, and YouTube marketing techniques.
-Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
-Strong project management and organizational skills.
-Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
-Creative thinking and problem-solving skills.
-Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret data.
-Experience with marketing automation tools and CRM systems is a plus.
If you are passionate about marketing and have experience in the dental industry, I encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to help grow our client's dental clinics.

Description:
Introduction

The role of a social media manager has become increasingly important in today's digital age. With the explosion of social media platforms, companies and organizations need someone who can manage their online presence effectively. A social media manager is responsible for creating and implementing social media strategies, managing social media accounts, creating and sharing content, engaging with followers, and analyzing social media data. In this article, we will discuss in detail the job description, responsibilities, and qualifications required for a social media manager.

Job Description

A social media manager is responsible for managing a company's social media accounts, creating and sharing content, engaging with followers, and analyzing social media data. The social media manager will be responsible for developing and implementing a social media strategy that is aligned with the company's goals and objectives. The manager will create and curate content for social media platforms such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, and other social media channels.

Responsibilities

Developing Social Media Strategies: A social media manager is responsible for developing a comprehensive social media strategy that is aligned with the company's goals and objectives. This includes determining which social media platforms to use, creating a content calendar, and developing campaigns that will engage followers.
Creating Content: A social media manager is responsible for creating and curating content that is engaging and relevant to the target audience. This includes creating posts, videos, images, and other content that will be shared on social media platforms.
Managing Social Media Accounts: A social media manager is responsible for managing the company's social media accounts. This includes monitoring and responding to comments, messages, and other interactions on social media platforms.
Engaging with Followers: A social media manager is responsible for engaging with followers on social media platforms. This includes responding to comments, answering questions, and engaging in conversations.
Analyzing Social Media Data: A social media manager is responsible for analyzing social media data to determine the effectiveness of social media campaigns. This includes analyzing engagement rates, reach, and other metrics.
Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
Previous experience managing social media accounts for a company or organization.
Knowledge of social media platforms, including Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, and others.
Ability to create engaging content for social media platforms.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to analyze social media data and make data-driven decisions.
Creative thinking and problem-solving skills.
Familiarity with social media analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Hootsuite, and others.
Experience with social media advertising and paid campaigns.
Conclusion

A social media manager is an essential role for any company or organization that wants to maintain a strong online presence. The manager is responsible for developing and implementing social media strategies, managing social media accounts, creating and sharing content, engaging with followers, and analyzing social media data. To be successful in this role, the social media manager must have a bachelor's degree in marketing or communications, previous experience managing social media accounts, knowledge of social media platforms, excellent communication skills, strong organizational skills, and an ability to analyze social media data. If you are interested in hiring a social media manager, the above job description, responsibilities, and qualifications can be used as a guide to help you find the right candidate for your company.

In this article, we will discuss in detail the job description, responsibilities, and qualifications required for a social media manager.

A social media manager is responsible for managing a company's social media accounts, creating and sharing content, engaging with followers, and analyzing social media data. Job Title: Creative and passionate Entry -level Product Manager Needed
Description:
We are at an exciting era of growth and are looking for a smart and passionate individual who shares our mission of assisting small businesses in their success by providing excellent Tax and Business Advice services. This is a role for a creative person who wants to help define and develop out the array of expert collaboration tools that allow our customers and experts (Accountants and Lawyers) to work together seamlessly. We're searching for someone with a merciless attention to detail, a desire to cooperate in a team setting, and a love of the ambiguity that comes with being a product manager.

You will:

• Collaborate closely with customers to fully comprehend their collaboration preferences and requirements.
• Work with partners in design, engineering, operations, marketing, and analytics to translate concepts into experiences that the team will deliver. 
• You will be responsible for the overall success of these projects, from discovery to launch.
• Use a combination of quantitative analysis, qualitative research, and industry standard procedures to identify new chances to improve these experiences.
• Prioritize the set of product initiatives that you and your team will provide, while also providing for near-term deliverables and longer-term investments in technological platforms, all while maintaining a platform perspective.

You have:

• 2+ years of product management experience is required; a mix of consumer-facing and expert-facing experience is preferable.
• Prior expertise negotiating product scale difficulties in a high growth context, including the creation of experiences shared by many customer personas
• Data-driven mindset with demonstrated experience using metrics and insights as decision-making tools 
• Fluent with software development practices and experience working closely with design and engineering teams throughout the full product lifecycle, including research, planning, implementation, launch, and post-launch learning 
• Have a learn fast, fail fast approach, eager to disrupt the status quo, and compelling storytelling and communication abilities with the ability to adjust your style as you work with others up, down, and beside you in the organization.

Job Title: LinkedIn & Company Website Research And Contact List Generation
Description:
Hi!

TASK:  
I have a list of ~150 companies that I will provide to you in Excel.  I am seeking someone to find employee names and contact info at these companies based on employee titles.

Titles include:
CFO
Asset Manager
Portfolio Manager
* Finance * or * Investments *

Note that with 150 companies and ~four contacts each, this is roughly 600 contacts for which I am seeking contact info which would be dropped into the excel file I provide.

For each individual contact, the contact info I'd ideally like:
Contact name
Contact LinkedIn hyperlink
Contact hyperlink (if available) to the individual on the company web page as typically found on links to "Employees", "About Us", etc
A contact email address which has been verified
Contact business phone number

In addition, for each company, I'd like the company's LinkedIn page hyperlink, and the company website hyperlink dropped into fields of the excel page.

ADDITIONAL ASSIGNMENTS:
While this is a one-off project, if this works well, similar assignments will be available.  

PAST EXPERIENCE:  
While past commercial real estate experience is NOT required for this assignment, please highlight if you are familiar with job titles and functions within the commercial real estate industry as this may be useful in future projects.

OUTPUT:
Expected delivery of contact info is in an excel sheet but  I am open to other ideas.  Sample Excel file attached.  The green fields are the Company Names that I will provide, and the orange fields are the data I'd like you to collect.  The address is so that if there is more than one person with a given title, you can select someone closest to the address.  It is likely that not all Companies can be found and that some titles at given companies will not exist.

FLEXIBILITY:  
I am open to format changes if it makes the assignment easier for you (as I am more interested in complete and accurate content than formatting).  Also open to discussion about change in content scope.

TIMING:
Ideally would like delivery within five business days but have some flexibility.  I feel like this can be done relatively independently, but happy to answer questions along the way.

Job Title: Automating Client Reporting Data from HighLevel [CRM] & Pandadoc [Quotes] to Airtable
Description:
Background:

Our events company uses HighLevel as its customer relationship management (CRM) system to manage customer information and track client interactions. We use Pandadoc to send client quotes and accept payments.

As our company has grown, the volume of client data we collect and report on has increased, and we have found that manually inputting data into our reporting system is time-consuming and prone to errors. 

We would like to automate this process to save time and reduce errors. Our goal is to seamlessly transfer data between HighLevel [CRM], Pandadoc [Quoting] to Airtable so that we have all of our lead and sales data in one place [Airtable] so that we can run custom relational database reports.

Objective:

The objective of this project is to automate the process of transferring client reporting data from HighLevel CRM and Pandadc to Airtable using Make (Integromat). We are seeking a specialist who can show us the possibilities of automating the process, based on our sales process and how it currently works, and then quote to build the necessary automation in Make, Airtable, Highlevel.

Scope:

The project includes the following tasks:

1. Review the current HighLevel CRM system and Airtable setup to understand the data fields required for client reporting and their mapping between systems.

2. Identify potential automation options that could streamline the data transfer process from HighLevel to Airtable, considering factors such as frequency of data transfer, volume of data, and data quality control measures.

3. Develop a plan to implement the selected automation solution and estimate the timeline and resources required.

4. Test the automation solution to ensure data accuracy and completeness.

5. Train our team members on how to use and maintain the new automated process.

Deliverables:

The deliverables of this project are:

1. A meeting to fully scope out the project.

2. Areport/ agreed project scope, detailing the identified automation options and the selected solution.

3. A detailed plan for the implementation of the selected automation solution.

4. A fully functioning automation solution that transfers client reporting data from HighLevel and Pandadoc to Airtable.


Timeline:

The project should be completed within 4-6 weeks, with progress updates every two weeks. The timeline should take into account the availability of our team members for testing and training.

Budget:

Our budget for this project is flexible, and we are willing to consider a range of quotes based on the scope and complexity of the automation solution.

Conclusion:

We believe that automating the process of transferring client reporting data from HighLevel CRM and Pandadoc to/from Airtable will improve our efficiency and accuracy in reporting, allowing us to better serve our clients. We look forward to working with a specialist who can help us achieve this goal.

Job Title: Creative Project Manager (With a Passion for Leveraging AI)
Description:
We are seeking a Creative Project Manager with a strong background in Digital Media, Marketing, SEO and Social Media Management. The person should have exceptional organizational and communication skills to support our Fortune 1000 C-Suite executive clients in their thought leadership endeavors. The ideal candidate will have experience managing creative projects, a strong understanding of industry trends, and a passion for delivering high-quality, innovative content. They should excel at collaborating with diverse teams and stakeholders, ensuring all projects are completed on time and within budget.

Goals-oriented projects are key. The ability to decipher and form a brand strategy for an executive and their thought leadership message, convert that into projects, digital manage those projects and get those projects DONE. You are building roadmaps based on objectives. They are strategic and they get results.

Duties, Responsibilities, and Skills:

1. Project management: Oversee the execution of creative projects from inception to completion, ensuring that they meet client objectives, deadlines, and budgets.

2. Effective communication: Confidently liaise with Fortune 1000 C-Suite executives, understanding their goals and translating their vision into actionable project plans.

3. Team coordination: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including writers, designers, and other stakeholders, to ensure seamless collaboration and delivery of high-quality content.

4. Industry knowledge: Stay up-to-date with current trends and best practices in thought leadership and digital trends, adapting processes and strategies as needed to remain competitive.

5. Resource allocation: Assess project requirements and allocate resources effectively, ensuring optimal use of time, budget, and talent.

6. Quality control: Implement and maintain quality control measures to guarantee the production of top-tier content that meets or exceeds client expectations.

7. Problem-solving: Proactively identify and address potential roadblocks or challenges, devising solutions to keep projects on track and within scope.

8. Reporting and analysis: Monitor project progress and provide regular updates to clients and stakeholders, analyzing performance metrics to inform future strategies and improvements.

9. Effective delegation: Successfully manage and delegate tasks to our network of freelancers, ensuring clear communication of expectations, timelines, and deliverables. This includes selecting the right talent for each project, providing necessary guidance and support, and fostering a collaborative work environment to drive high-quality results.

10. Hiring freelance talent: Demonstrated experience in hiring and vetting freelance talent, including video editors, ghostwriters, illustrators, researchers, and social media managers. Familiarity with platforms such as Upwork, Freelancer, or other similar platforms is required. The candidate must possess the confidence to identify and onboard the best talent for each project.

11. Resource allocation and foresight: Possess the discipline and insight to allocate resources effectively, while proactively identifying the need to expand the talent pool based on project requirements and industry trends. This includes anticipating future demands, ensuring that the team is prepared to handle new challenges, and maintaining a high level of adaptability and responsiveness to client needs.

Job Title: OBM Marketing VA, Project Manager Implementor
Description:
We are seeking a talented and motivated Program Implementation Specialist and Online Business Manager (OBM) to join our team. As a Program Implementation Specialist and OBM, you will be responsible for coordinating and executing the launch of various programs, ensuring their successful implementation, and providing ongoing support to our team and clients. Additionally, you will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of the business, including managing our virtual assistant (VA) team as we grow, and implementing systems and project management tools to manage the entire project.

Responsibilities:

Work with our team to plan and coordinate the launch of various programs, including the development of timelines, project plans, and budgets.
Implement and manage the various aspects of the program launch, including coordinating with internal and external stakeholders, managing program resources, and ensuring program quality and effectiveness.
Provide ongoing support to our team and clients throughout the program launch, including troubleshooting any issues that arise and identifying opportunities for improvement.
Analyze program data to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for program enhancement.
Communicate program progress, results, and impact to internal and external stakeholders, including clients, partners, and senior leadership.
Oversee the day-to-day operations of the business, including managing the VA team, implementing systems and project management tools, and streamlining processes to improve efficiency.
Build sales funnels, implement GoHighLevel, and use automation to improve lead generation and sales conversion rates.
Understand project flow and implement systems and project management tools to manage the entire project.
Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in program management, project management, or a related field.
Experience in the real estate or coaching industry is a plus.
Strong project management skills, including the ability to plan, prioritize, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with a wide range of stakeholders.
Strong analytical skills and experience working with data.
Proficient in project management software such as Asana, Trello, or Basecamp.
Experience with funnel building, GoHighLevel, automation, and project management tools.
Understanding of project flow and the ability to implement systems and project management tools to manage the entire project.
Experience managing a team of VAs.
If you are a motivated, detail-oriented, and results-driven individual with a passion for launching successful programs, managing a team of VAs, and implementing systems and project management tools to improve efficiency, we encourage you to apply. We offer a competitive salary to grow into, flexible work arrangements, and opportunities for professional growth and development.

HELP! I need someone to help me with the marketing of my new online course. I have no email funnels, the website needs some work, and my social media has not been updated in months. I need someone who is going to push me in the right direction with an overall marketing strategy and content development. The extent of my marketing knowledge is a handful of YouTube videos.

I'm a negotiation/career coach. I do 1-1 coaching sessions and facilitate workshops. I'm now launching my online course teaching women how to negotiate. It is in the final revisions with the video editor and will soon be up on Kajabi. My target audience is women in their 30s and 40s, predominantly in white-collar professions (which means Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn will likely be my avenues of marketing). 

What I DO have:
- a brand guide with fonts and colors developed with a previous marketing professional (a friend who did me a favor)
- drafts of all the video modules so you can see the tone I set and who my target audience would be

I'm looking for an experienced professional, a good listener, and effective communicator. If you are interested, please provide a high-level roadmap in your proposal. I'd like to get started as soon as possible.

Requirements/Traits:

PLEASE NOTE: To be considered for this role, you must meet ALL of the requirements and traits listed below:

- Exceptional English language skills
- Possess a good computer and a stable internet connection
- Extremely ambitious and driven
- Have 2+ years of experience with Facebook Ads (no other ad platform expertise required)
- Have extensive knowledge of marketing concepts, including conversion rates, creatives, advertorials, and the full marketing picture
- Not involved with any other brand or project
- Available to work 250+ hours per month, 7 days a week. Please read "Working Hours and Time Availability" for details.


PLEASE DO NOT APPLY if you do not match ALL of the requirements and traits. We will conduct a thorough check and automatically reject any candidate who does not meet even one of the criteria.


Salary:
The salary will consist of a fixed hourly pay plus profit share. Further details will be discussed in the next step of the hiring process, but to set proper expectations, you can expect a $16/hour pay if decent KPIs are met, and it can go as high as $38/hour in case results are truly exceptional.


Working Hours and Time Availability:

We require an availability of 250+ working hours per month, 7 days a week. However, one day per week will be part-time (2-4 hours), which will be your "off" day to check and turn off a few ads, essentially just maintaining them.


The Company:

We are a fully remote company based in Italy with over 15 employees. One-third of our team lives in Italy, and the remaining two-thirds are in the Philippines. We have a warehouse in Italy that is entirely managed by a logistic center, and we run an inventory-based model (we do not drop ship). Our primary focus is on providing a wide range of products, excellent customer service, and fast shipping, with the majority of our orders paid on delivery (currently 95% are COD).

Our goal is to make the purchase of any product accessible to everyone, with any payment method, especially cash on delivery.
(more details regarding our company will be given in the next step of the hiring process)


The Job:

As a CMO, you will be responsible for:
- Managing our Facebook ads (high-level expertise is required)
- Managing our Google and TikTok ads as well (previous experience not required)
- Managing the ideation of all our ads across all ad platforms (not the creation, just the ideation)
- Managing the entire funnel ideation and execution, including testing new landing pages to improve conversion rates, testing new angles, and testing advertorials
- Anything that can yield a higher return on our ad spend.

Note: Further explanations will be given in the next step of the hiring process, but to make it simple, I, the founder, am searching for someone who can help me grow this business and handle everything regarding marketing while I focus on ops, HR, and other tasks that are my strengths.

Job Title: Help get my photos shared and published and grow my Instagram for creative brand photography
Description:
I am a photographer and am newly leading a creative team specializing in photo/video campaigns for small brands that embody the following attributes -
colorful, queer, conscious, glamorous, fashionable, musical, fun

ISO someone to help ORGANICALLY grow my Instagram following on my personal account - I share other realms of my life on this page too, but mostly photos - it's NOT a business account - where I share creative brand photography work. I am looking for more work in this realm and believe having more followers and engagement on my posts could benefit that.
For example my last shoot was for a New Orleans based perfume brand and featured a model in drag makeup and high fashion style outfitting. I would love to advertise this creative direction and my creative team as a package deal to future brands and people who need content.
This is a small project for now as I am looking for something short term to jump start this type of engagement. I have a lot of exciting work to share and am interested in getting my numbers higher so similar brands notice my page and get in touch to work with me as well.

What I would love from you-
-Engagement with accounts who follow similar brands / creators to bring attention to my page. 
-Increase 500 followers organically ASAP, without "follow for follow"
-Create a list of brands I could reach out to about collaboration or booking shoots
-Finding worthwhile TFP product shoots if they exist (I am not open to shooting for free unless it's an opportunity I can't pass up)
-Help with posting strategies and timing to get the most engagement 
-Research and make a list of viable magazines to publish our work, in print or on Instagram. You could find these through the Insta platform or via Kavyar (though I am looking for someone who can vet the magazines on there, many are not legit and don't even have a following)

What I do NOT want you to do -
-Post for me
-Write and post stories without my approval
-Respond to messages

I have a very specific ideas about what work I want shared and the overall look of my feed. I am totally open to ideas and suggestions but because I am particular about aesthetics, and because this is also my personal page, I do not want anyone posting on my behalf. Writing comments to other people + brands on other peoples' pages though is great.

I am NOT an "influencer" and do not want to be perceived as attempting these tactics as I personally find most of them distasteful so I am approaching this very carefully and organically as possible, so the person I am working with needs to understand that. This is not a job for every social media marketer out there. Please make a note of your understanding of this in your proposal otherwise I will move on to the next. Thank you!

Nestled at the bottom of the Hollywood Hills, our West Hollywood coworking space provides the perfect day at the office. - Knowledge of SEO best practices

- Comfortable receiving and implementing copy edits and editorial feedback

Ciao a tutti,

Ho una vita molto presa, ho diversi progetti che sto sviluppando e mi ritrovo spesso senza tempo. Una di queste attività, ovvero quella di tuo interesse, è la mia “Agenzia di marketing”. Da ormai anni aiuto diverse aziende leader in Italia nel loro settore ad aumentare margini e profitti e devo dire che va piuttosto bene.

Questo perché offro un servizio che in pochi in italia possono dare: garantire risultati, altrimenti è gratis.

In soldoni, ricerco aziende ad alto potenziale e successivamente le aiuto a crescere velocemente, senza chiedere un centesimo se non porto risultati.

Se da un lato dunque ci sono molte possibilità anche di guadagno, dall’altra c’è la difficoltà di dover gestire tutti i progetti. Sì, perché non sono in pochi a richiedermelo (proprio per la mia garanzia totale).

Sto quindi cercando una figura che mi aiuti a:

1. Ricercare talenti

Sì, perché se troviamo aziende interessanti che sono appena partite e, ovviamente, noi facciamo il nostro lavoro, tutti ne beneficiamo. 

Il goal sarebbe essere sempre più bravi a trovare quelle aziende che partono da zero ma con belle prospettive.

2. Gestione della comunicazione e dell’aspetto operativo

Lavorando con aziende che partono da zero, spesso non hanno team, dunque dobbiamo essere in grado di creare un’offerta ad hoc, un sito e scrivere i vari copy. Le mansioni saranno esattamente queste.


Ovviamente ogni singola cosa non sarà lasciata al caso e verrà spiegato tutto nei minimi dettagli, con template pronti per velocizzare il processo operativo.

Parlando nel concreto, la disponibilità sarà via via maggiore, ovviamente in funzione dei clienti. Più si cresce, più si lavora. Prevedo comunque all’inizio un lavoro di 2-3 ore al giorno, ma nel giro di un mese si potrebbe già dover gestire in autonomia 5-10 progetti.


Per la questione economica, tutto gira intorno ai risultati che si portano ma, per darti delle stime, per un singolo progetto potresti guadagnare in media dai 200€ ai 500€.

Non voglio far passare che si possa guadagnare molto con poco, perché dietro c’è sicuramente del lavoro da fare e dobbiamo farlo dannatamente bene.

Ma come vedi è molto meritocratico: se si semina bene, si raccoglie bene.


Se ti interessa, rispondi a questa proposal, facendo questa piccola task:

1. Cerca un talento: dimmi un nome di un’azienda che potrebbe essere interessante. 
2. Fai un video loom in cui mi dici cosa faresti per aiutarla a quantomeno triplicare il fatturato.

Non è necessario che tu mi dia la risposta esatta, mi piacerebbe solo vedere come ragioni.

Inoltre, inserisci nella prima frase la parola: talent.

Spero di vederti presto

Salvatore

Job Title: SEO / SEM Wizard for Niche Business Site
Description:
At The Offsite Co., we design hyper-customized Company Retreats for the worlds coolest companies. Our mission is to design retreats and offsites where colleagues connect as HUMANS. 

We have designed over 3,000 retreats around the world for our clients since 2017. From Santa Cruz to Morrocco, our process is the same. 

We are small team, more like a family. We are all contractors coming together each week to execute on our mission on-behalf of our clients. 

About the Role: 

We are looking for an SEO/SEM Specialist to drive organic and paid demand for current and future business segments. 

This role is perfect for someone who is driven, analytical, collaborative, and can execute autonomously at a high-level. Successful candidates in this role should be equally comfortable driving and executing strategies, all the while maintaining and optimizing performance. 

What You’ll Be Doing:

SEO: Develop a strategic SEO roadmap, create seo-friendly landing pages and content, conduct keyword and content research, experiment with AI, update metadata, and own bi-weekly performance reporting.

Providing a long-term ROI reporting on investment in SEO. 

SEM/Paid Ads: Develop, implement, and continually optimize/iterate paid media campaigns on Google Ads, as well as identifying new channels to trial for lead generation.

Collaboration: Triage technical issues for SEO and SEM. 

Experimentation: Implement a process to ideate, prioritize, and execute ongoing growth experiments to both discover new tactics & optimize existing programs.

What You Bring To The Table:

4+ years of marketing experience relevant to growth, SEO/SEM, paid media, and demand generation

SEO capabilities including knowledge of SEO algorithms and ranking methods, keywords, and implementation of ongoing optimization strategies. 

Track record of developing programs for service businesses that meet or exceed key metrics and ROI.

Experience developing, implementing and maintaining/optimizing paid marketing plans, particularly on search (SEO/SEM).

Experience running testing campaigns and experimentation programs.

Proficient organizational and planning skills, adept at building a strong campaign structures and scalable process to organize experiment ideas, execution, and results.

Strong analytical skills, able to evaluate results of campaigns and recommend action.

Stakeholder management: Excellent at communicating and partnering with senior leadership and stakeholders at all levels across the organization

We are looking for an expert to aggressively improve our past and current content strategy while creating a record setting playbook for future traffic and conversions.

Job Title: Freelance Social Media Community Manager and Content Strategist – UK
Description:
At VeraContent, we are looking for someone who can fill a dual role of:
- Social media content strategy expert for the UK market

- Social media community manager for the UK market
Instagram, Facebook and TikTok

*Our client is a global electronics accessory company.

This role entails:

Managing social media content and interacting with users on an ongoing basis
Analyzing strategy and creating monthly reports

Main tasks:
Creating and collaborating with the client on social media strategy for the UK market 
Suggesting effective ways to adapt our client’s social media calendar for the UK market, considering local trends, current events and holidays, popular influencers in the market, etc.
Scheduling posts throughout the month on Instagram, Facebook and TikTok
Managing social media content and interacting with users on an ongoing basis (understanding and adhering to social media best practices) 
Trying out new methods and strategies to grow engagement and follower count, with different content types, campaigns and promotions
Creating social media content from scratch when necessary (and be in front of the camera)
Evaluating content performance, creating reports with data-driven insights and providing future recommendations based on them
Sharing feedback/insights about the community
Keeping in contact with the client on a regular basis
Possibly being responsible for the EU account in the future as well

What we’re looking for:
Native-level English (UK). Excellent writing and communication skills in English
Be based in the UK (ideally England, most ideally London) with very strong knowledge of societal trends in the UK market
Understanding of social media best practices for businesses, especially on Instagram, TikTok and Facebook
Able to create content when necessary (and be in front of the camera)
Experience with scheduling posts and using social media management tools such as Later
Strong time management skills and responsiveness
Availability to work a minimum of 6-8 hours a week for this project
Able to create a content calendar including a variety of elements (feed posts, Stories, Reels) in line with the latest trends
Flexible working style and ability to adapt to new situations and clients' changing needs
Ability to quickly learn new software tools and business processes
Ability to analyze metrics and provide insights into target audience, content and strategy to increase brand awareness, reach and web traffic

What you’ll enjoy:
Growing your portfolio with quality work to show to your clients
Getting constructive feedback on all your work
Collaborating with a tight-knit and international team

Job Title: Press Releases and Distribution Support Needed
Description:
Since 1988, Monarch Awards Foundation, Inc., has proudly established a rich history of serving Chicagoland’s diverse communities. Established as a not-for-profit 501(c)(3) charitable organization with the purpose of implementing community service programs, scholarships and charitable donations to other not-for-profits, our programs target six areas of need and include:

• Youth Enrichment (especially girls)
• Health and Wellness
• Global Poverty
• Economic Security
• Human Rights
• Social Justice

Since its inception, Monarch Awards Foundation, Inc., has awarded more than $1,100,000 in scholarships and donations to not-for-profit organizations.

Our PR team is rather small, so we are looking for a partner who can help us create 2 press releases for upcoming events. We prefer someone with experience working with non-profits, has media relations experience as well as a large network of media contacts in the Chicagoland area for press distribution. The person should have a proven track record of success and work samples for review. 

Our upcoming events include a scholarship gala (December 16th) and a teen mental health awareness workshop (May 20th). Because our work has to go through a series of approvals, we'd like to begin now. Our goal is to successfully promote our events, maximize our reach to increase event attendance and exceed our program goals for the year. 

Should the partnership work well, we will continue to partner with them long term. 

We are happy to provide more information upon request.

Job Title: Sales Assistant Wanted- Web Research, Addressing and Mailing, Calling on Potential Customers
Description:
Renaissance Patio Products is seeking to add a part time sales assistant to our team. This position would include performing research online, specifically, which companies in a given area are in the business of installing patio cover, pools, decks, etc.... Creating a list of targets based on that research, using local business site, linked in, company websites to locate the name of the business owners etc. Using that list to send hand addressed personalized mailers, then  following up on those mailers with phone calls, e mails.

We would like to find someone who works in advance of our in person sales efforts. We determine a new market we would like to build up, you would perform the research, build out the target list, send out mailers, work with our in the field sales team to identify the ones that look the most promising, follow up, follow up, follow up.

This is a job that can be done from anywhere within the US. We are only interested in native speakers of English who are strong communicators, keep records well, can work on a team.

For the right person, this can evolve into a high paid sales position over time.

Job Title: Audit and Assessment of Google Ads Account
Description:
Looking for an expert PPC strategist to assess optimization opportunities and recommend strategies to enhance the performance of our company’s Google Ads investment. This is a lead gen program with the conversion happening through a Hubspot from on our corporate website. 

Questions to answer include:
1)	How can we optimize keywords and campaigns to best connect with our Ideal Customer Profile (and limit wasted on low quality inquiries?)
2)	Are we using the most appropriate bid strategies to maximize leads?
3)	Which keywords and campaigns should we invest more in to accelerate lead gen? And which should we abandon?
4)	How should we (re)configure conversions (or GA4 events) to feedback the most valuable and relevant actions to the Google AI?

You won’t need to make any of the changes in this engagement, simply make recommendations. Execution of the work will be based on your estimate of the time required to implement.

Job Title: Marketing Coordinator for a Small Agency
Description:
About the Position

We are a small Internet Marketing consulting agency seeking part-time help with various marketing projects.   The Marketing Coordinator will be given hands-on training from our experienced team, making it ideal for a student seeking a career in Internet Marketing or someone making a career-transition.   We are willing to select an entry-level candidate given the right fit.  The Marketing Coordinator will perform a balance of marketing skills in all of the following areas:

Search Engine Management (SEM)
Organic (SEO)
Paid (PPC)
Display Advertisement (Banners, etc.)
Email Marketing
Marketing Analysis
Social Media Management Marketing
Content Development & Copywriting
Onsite Merchandising and Conversion Optimization
Research skills

This is an ideal position for a self-starter and energetic individual ready to begin a Marketing career.  

Expectations of Applicants

- Organized to the point of obsession
- Comfort working in a highly unstructured environment 
We are a highly virtual organization.  The Marketing Coordinator must be prepared and able to work at home or other locations with limited supervision. 
- High attention to detail
- Willingness to learn and quickly apply new skills
 The Marketing Coordinator will be trained, but it is expected that he/she will spend time own their own learning and sharpening their skills. 
- Objective and systematic approach to problem solving 
- Flexible schedule and hours
 The workload for the Marketing Coordinator currently fluctuates between 10-30 hours per week.  The Marketing Coordinator must be able to balance their schedule to meet deadlines.


Requirements:
Completed, or currently pursuing, a Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited 4-year institution
The ability to present yourself personally and virtually in a professional and intelligent manner
Highly proficient in Office applications (Excel, Word, etc.)
Passion for learning and application
Demonstrated history of leadership

Pluses for Applicants:
Academic background in Marketing or Mathematical Science
High GPA and recommendations from Instructors/ employers

Application Instructions

Apply for this position on Upwork. Submit a resume and cover letter.  In your cover letter, please explain why you believe you are the right candidate for this position.  Since the Marketing Coordinator position is entry-level, more weight will be given to cover letters than resumes.  Applications without cover letters will not be considered.  

**Please carefully read the application requirements.  If you do not meet these requirements your application will not be considered.

Job Title: Paid media specialist for digital marketing agency
Description:
Responsibilities
The 1o8 Paid Media team is built to help our clients win by maintaining a relentless focus on achieving business growth KPIs in our media campaigns.

The Paid Digital Media Manager is responsible for the development, execution, and optimization of paid media campaigns and performance reporting and analysis for assigned clients, as well as overseeing direct reports. 

The right candidate has experience with consumer brands and can support cross-functional teams to drive growth for our clients by leading with curiosity and critical thinking: asking probing questions, anticipating and addressing barriers.

Day-to-day requirements:
Develop single and multi-channel media plans for varying client goals, demonstrating knowledge of each channel's role within a holistic media strategy
Use Facebook and other social platforms, Google Ads, Amazon, and DSPs to build and optimize campaigns to maximize performance (e.g. ROAS) for assigned clients 
Identify and understand client goals in order to autonomously create campaign structures, pace accounts, and perform optimizations across multiple client accounts
Extract insights from campaign data, identify relevant trends, and provide thoughtful, proactive recommendations to exceed client goals 
Deliver monthly reporting and ad hoc campaign updates for assigned clients
Ideal Experience
The ideal candidate flourishes in an entrepreneurial environment and is both a thinker and a doer - someone who thrives on the ability to help solve our clients’ largest problems.

5-8 years managing digital media campaigns in an agency setting
Demonstrated track record of hands-on campaign management 
Track record of expertly counseling clients, managing issues and meeting business goals 
Advanced analytical, statistical analysis, organizational and time management skills
Ability to think strategically with a focus on innovative and measurable client solutions

Job Title: Digital Marketing, Including Google Ads and CRO
Description:
SkillBurst Interactive is seeking an exceptional Digital Marketing expert for an initial 3-month project to make a BIG impact.  The Digital Marketing expert will work with us to plan, research, create, implement, monitor, and maintain a successful digital marketing campaign.  The goal of the campaign is to increase conversion volume and quality, while ultimately driving sales. 

This project will include milestones, established in coordination with you, and may be expanded for longer-term support.  We envision this initial 3-month engagement to market one specific offering and to include:

•	New campaign and ad group creation and launch, leveraging single keyword ad groups and other approaches that you recommend in order to optimize performance and conversions
•	Keyword research, management, bid optimization, and ongoing analysis and refinement
•	Target audience and geographic set-up, ongoing analysis, and improvements
•	Competitor analysis and recommendations learned through analysis
•	Ongoing monitoring, analysis, and maintenance to optimize campaign performance while working to reduce cost per acquisition  
•	Tracking conversions and continually working to improve campaign performance
•	Conversion rate optimization, including landing page recommendations
Additionally, we’d like you to:
•	Recommend new campaigns for future marketing efforts
•	Recommend budgets, allocations, and other opportunities for consideration

The goal of this initiative is to establish and scale a robust digital marketing campaign focused on one specific offering and timeline (for now) that pays for itself (and more) through sales generation.  Quantitative and qualitative performance goals and measures should be established during the planning stage, tracked, and routinely analyzed and reported against to ensure we have a clear understanding of performance and results.

At this time, we are looking for someone to serve as our digital marketing advisor and implementation expert.  We are looking for a candidate that is happy and willing to partner and work closely with our small team to explain and educate throughout the process (we are not marketing experts).  This includes communicating in easy-to-understand terms and ensuring campaign plans, research findings, approaches, performance results, evolving ideas and tactics, and anything else of value and importance is shared proactively along the way. In support of this initiative, we will provide ad copy and content needed, but will look to you for feedback and recommendations to support optimal ad performance. 

** We have an ongoing need for this kind of assistance, so while we are starting with a specific target in mind, we're looking to create a long-term working relationship with the right person (contract).**
