Job Title: Marketing Assistant for Busy Marketing Agency - Software/Ecommerce/SAAS/Tech Clients
Description:
Digital marketing agency in the Chicago area (U.S.) is seeking a marketing assistant with at least 2-3 years of experience in inbound marketing, content marketing and SEO. Must be familiar with or open to learning about software, ecommerce, SAAS and other technical verticals.

Please send the following information in your reply:

-a description of your background and skills
-a few samples of relevant work, including writing samples 
-If you have ever done any content audits, content gaps, editorial calendars, customer journeys and/or other similar deliverables, please send a few of those samples as well
-information about any relevant certifications or degrees that you hold
-If relevant, we'd also love to hear about specific results from some of the campaigns that you've handled--i.e. measurable increase in traffic, conversions, leads; media placements; other ways that you have helped clients meet measurable goals. 

We're particularly interested in hearing about your experience with the following:

-Brainstorming ideas for new and repurposed content for clients in multiple industries
-Conducting or utilizing keyword research to come up with content ideas, content titles, headings, on-page copy and optimizations, and/or email subjects and content
-Writing and publishing effective content for web pages, conversion paths (CTA, landing page, thank you page, form), emails, blogs, social media, etc. 
-Monitoring writers who create content, ensuring that it gets done on time and to a high degree of quality (including reviewing and editing content as needed)
-Optimizing content against keyword research and SEO best practices
-Creating lead magnets and offers that get results using Canva, Photoshop or other tools
-Identifying, tweaking or creating CTAs
-Assessing content of current sites or marketing materials and making recommendations for improvements
-Planning, creating and optimizing paid ad campaigns
-Experience creating site pages, landing pages, forms, emails and blog posts using WordPress and/or HubSpot
-Experience creating, publishing and monitoring social media a plus
-Ahrefs, SEMRush, Leadpages, BuzzStream and/or Google Analytics experience a major plus
-Must be comfortable participating in client phone calls during U.S. business hours with no background noise (REQUIRED)
-Should be comfortable communicating with our clients using an email address for our company, mostly during U.S. business hours (REQUIRED)
-Comfortable monitoring, responding to and resolving incoming client issues, requests and questions received via our online help desk Teamwork Desk or our client collaboration platform, Teamwork Project on a daily basis (REQUIRED)
-Comfortable communicating with other Flair team members via Skype, Teamwork.com, email and phone calls during U.S. business hours (REQUIRED)

We would love to hear from you if you meet many or all of the above criteria. Chicago area/U.S. candidates preferred, but we will consider candidates who are fluent in English located anywhere. ***Please include an audio introduction with your application if English is not your first language.***

Initially, we need urgent help with some short-term projects. We will also have an ongoing need for marketing assistants for additional longer-term projects in 2023 and beyond. This is an ideal fit for people who are freelancing on a permanent basis. 

IMPORTANT: Please do not apply if you are not available during U.S. business hours (i.e. if you're moonlighting). We're happy to work with your schedule if you have other clients, meetings or commitments to work around, but we do need someone who is available during most U.S. business hours.
Category 3: Ahrefs, SEMrush, WordPress, Google Analytics, Other

Description:
Really need a solid consultation with someone who's an expert in the digital product space like courses, for funnels, TikTok ads/Facebook ads.

I'm going to explain my system and what I'm having trouble with.

My system:
-I sell a course, and consulting for hiring virtual assistants for your business. I also offer hiring a VA for them. Price point $1000 to $3000.
-Wordpress with an opt in page, 25 minute VSL/book a free call page
-Activecampaign for email and sms marketing

-Spending $55 a day on FB Ads
-For people that don't seem to qualify on the call I offer a discount for the course.
-For people that seem like they are generating decent revenue I do a 2 call close.

Problems I'm Having: 
-My ads suddenly stopped bringing me a lot of leads although I increased my budget. Would like to fix this.
-Want to know which countries I should target for this price point.
-I'm not sure if the way my funnel is set up is optimized for booking as many calls as I can
-Would love suggestions on the funnel and ads.
-I use Lead Conversions on my ads but want to know how to also track booked calls on calendly with my pixel so I can have a column that shows cost per booked call.
-Possibly considering building a separate funnel just to sell the course for a lower price point in other countries.

Ready for a call today please let me know.

Job Title: Social Media Support - Carousel Post data entry/Creator in Canva + Larger Canva Project
Description:
I am a Women's Empowerment Coach looking to align with a Heart-centered, Creative, Tech-smart Human, who wants to play a pivotal role in helping me spread love and share my voice through my social media and support my current students.  

Once you've read this ad, if you feel this would be in alignment with you, I'd love to hear from you.  You can let me know a bit about yourself, your experience, and why it feels like a good fit.  :)   

*The job is listed in USD for payment.  I am in Canada and have converted the rate accordingly from 15$CAD per hour. 

Seeking a virtual assistant for two specific Canva projects in my business. 

1.  ONGOING weekly Support - CAROUSEL POSTS 
What I need:  3 completed Carousel Posts in Canva, ready for me to download and use the coming week by Sunday evening EST (Ottawa, Canada time).  
Your role:  
-DATA ENTRY of the written content I provided from google document entered into pre-prepared templates. 
- very small refinements/tweaks to ensure the post is visually pleasing.
- Small design elements - from time to time add a graphic/chart/visual aid if the post calls for it.  This could mean finding the perfect one in Canva or taking my description/hand drawing of what and making it happen.

My expectation is that with your level of expertise, working within your zone of genius while having fun doing this, it will take max 1 HOUR per week to make the 3 posts.   

2.  ONE TIME PROJECT - PROGRAM WORKBOOK Design, Data Entry, and Creation.

This project involves working with bits and pieces of worksheets and content I have designed and used with clients over the years and also a ton of written content that I have in google documents.   I'll provide creative direction, a specific outline, and order to put it all in and you will amalgamate and pull it all together in one big client WorkBook called the Foundations Playbook.  

- You'll see that a design style is already a bit established with some of the parts but you'll also be taking creative inspiration from the carousel templates design style.  
- You'll mostly be doing data entry, and cut/copy/paste here but there will definitely be a fun design element.  

- My budget for this project is 12 hours maximum.  

ABOUT YOU: 

- You love working with Canva and are experienced doing it. (you've got great references) 
- Being a VA is totally within your zone of genius.  
- You are both creative and 'techie' so this work feels easy, aligned, and fun.  Because of this, you work FAST.  
- You have an entrepreneurial spirit, and that's why supporting another entrepreneur feels really awesome! 
- You are into personal development in a big way.  You are someone who does "the work" so to speak.   
- You understand that editing and amalgamating the workbook for a coaching program means that you will see the teachings my students pay thousands of dollars for.  That perk is SO not lost on you! 
-That being said, you are trustworthy.  You understand that you will be seeing proprietary information and intellectual property and would never violate the terms of your agreement with me. 
-You understand what radical self-responsibility means and you strive for this.  
- You are heart-centered, caring, and empathetic.  
- You are excited about the long-term relationship this could be if it's the right fit.  

ABOUT ME: 

- I am a Women's empowerment Coach, Somatic Practitioner, Trauma Integration Practitioner, and Spiritual Mentor for Determined Women. 
- I am deeply heart-centered and Empathetic.
- I value high-quality design and it's one of my greatest passions.  I am aesthetically very sensitive. 
- I am on a mission to end the epidemic of "Not Good Enough" in this lifetime and I am deeply committed to this as a coach and leader.  
- I am not a techie person so you will probably receive photos of hand-drawn graphics that I need to be made from time to time.  Also, I may not know the terms for things and I'll just give directions the best I can.  I'm that person. 
- I am a 6/2 Sacral Generator. Leo Sun, Leo Rising, Taurus Moon.

Job Title: Need a PR Person Familiar with Ryan Holidays Strategies
Description:
Not looking for traditional media pitching strategies. Looking for someone that has read the book Trust Me I'm Lying by Ryan Holiday and can put the strategies to work.

How best to work with me:
1. Do what you say you're going to do when you say you're going to do it. Don't make promises you can't keep. Don't make excuses or create reasons why you can't get the work done (I've heard it all already... there's only so many times you can hear that a freelancer's power went out or they had a death in the family or there was a storm). Keep your deadlines no matter what. 
2. Don't fall off of the face of earth... stay in communication.
3. Use the tracker. Don't come up with lame reasons why you can't use the tracker ("It crashed" or "I forgot to use it" or “it doesn’t work on this device.”). For clarification, the tracker is the part that takes screenshots of your work and keeps track of your time for you. It IS NOT you adding manual time. Manual time won’t be approved.
4. Don't try to change the parameters of the job to make things easier on yourself. Accommodate what I need done.
5. The job is hourly. Don't try to negotiate a flat rate. On hourly tasks, please don’t ask me to release payment. Payment will automatically be released according to the platform’s schedule.
6. You must speak English well so that we can communicate properly.
7. Don't ask what my budget is. I'm usually talking with several freelancers to find the best price. So give me your best price, otherwise you will lose out on the job. I don’t like negotiating and if you’re willing to negotiate, that means that you didn’t give me your best price initially and you didn’t follow instructions.
8. I need this done ASAP. Please don’t accept the job and then tell me that you can’t start working on it now. Don’t give me a short deadline to get the job and then ask me for an extension later.
9. Please don’t ask me to close the project or ask me for feedback. There is no deadline to a project and keeping a project doesn’t hurt your account (please check with the platform to verify). I like to keep projects open so that I continue to use you when I need you.
10. When I ask you what the quickest time frame you can complete the job is… tell me. Don’t ask for my timeline. I’m always trying to find the person that can do it the fastest. Don’t turn my questions around on me. Just answer the questions.
11. If you’re in a different time zone than me, please make efforts to accommodate my time zone.
12. I hate chasing people so give me updates at least once a day and more frequent updates on urgent tasks.
13. Please don’t ask me to “jump on a call” (or zoom). This is my least favorite method of communication. Whatsapp is my preferred method of communication so that’s what we will use.
14. Please don’t ask for user names or passwords to my accounts unless you’ve accepted the job. This is for my security.
15. Don’t repeatedly message me “are you there?” Just tell me what you need and I will reply when I can. And don’t continually message me about the same thing if I haven’t responded.
16. I don’t want your team of people working on this. No agencies. I only want the owner of the profile working on this and I need direct access to them.
I will issue negative feedback for violating any of these items.




How to Apply:
Don’t send a copy of your resume or copy and paste your generic cover letter that you’ve sent to dozens of other employers (trust me, we’ll know). Instead, send us a personalized message referencing specific details in our posting (not just the title of the job) and tell us why you would be the best fit for the position (and what specific experience you have). In your reply, please also tell me how many hours a week you have available for work. Also, in your reply, please confirm that you agree to the 16 points above.

Job Title: Reservations and Marketing Associate, Host & Keep
Description:
Reservations and Marketing Associate, Host & Keep

Host and Keep is a vacation rental investment firm in South Florida. Our current property management territories are Broward and Miami Dade county with plans for territory expansion in 2023. The right candidate would need a car and be located central to our property locations.

A Reservations and Marketing Associate is a crucial part of our team in helping ensure reservation requests are handled dand responded quickly, efficiently and professionally. This is a dynamic role that oversees and monitors the company achieving its occupancy and rental rates for the month for all properties. The role also assists with sales support and marketing.

South Florida is one of the "hottest" vacation spots in the world, and we provide some of the best vacation rentals! We are looking for a dynamic leader to lead our Miami/Ft. Lauderdale property integrity, quality and guest readiness efforts. The role will be managing property booking calendars and guest relations.

The primary responsibilities of the Reservations and Marketing Associate will be through superb sales work. You are selling guests and encouraging them to finalize their bookings, promoting properties that meet their needs, supporting the team with real estate sales, appointment setting, information gathering and neatly tracking information in our CRM tool (Monday.com). The marketing component of the role is preparing the social media content following our messaging guidelines. Copywriting in English and spanish.


The nature of this position is both scheduled and on call as booking needs could arise in an unscheduled manner. The right candidate knows how to use excel, google suite, powerpoint, canva, monday.com and must have real estate sales support experience.

You Can Expect To Do The Following

Reservations and Marketing Associate’s performance will be based on their ability to complete tasks efficiently and without supervision, problem-solve independently, prioritize tasks, implement processes, and communicate effectively.

Oversee all social media planning, graphics, content and hashtags
Oversee email marketing efforts using mailchimp
Must have a closer personality, able to sell and persuade when needed, oversee follow ups 
Have full ownership for the booking calendar and closely focused on numbers for the occupancy goals and booking revenue goals
Communicating with the team effectively 
Act as liaison between guests and any department necessary internally
Respond to emergency situations as needed (including after hours)
Ability to use software task system and notification process for efficiency in receiving and assigning needs
Sales support will include scheduling real estate showings, using the MLS (Multiple listing software) and assisting with contract drafts for review
At least 1 year previous experience in property management or real estate sales support
Organized, ownership mentality, and detail-oriented
Ability to deal with prospective guests; solving guest inquiries in a timely manner with a hospitality and customer service first mindset
An ability to interact professionally and responsibly via phone and email with guests, owners, and vendors.
Flexible schedule of availability
Fluent in English and Spanish, written and verbal communication, in a highly professional manner

Rewarding Hard Work

Competitive pay
Yearly performance bonus 

Email resume to caroline@hostandkeep.com for consideration

Description:
We have a few brands and are looking for someone with experience to come on for them (2-4 brands, 3 starting, 1 established). • Communicate with followers, respond to queries in a timely manner and monitor customer reviews and direct messages to the accounts.
• Oversee social media accounts’ design (e.g., Facebook timeline cover, profile pictures and blog layout) primarily on Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok. 
• Suggest and implement new features to develop brand awareness, like promotions and competitions
• Stay up to date with current technologies and trends in social media, design tools and applications

• Hands on experience in content management
• Excellent copywriting skills
• Ability to deliver creative content (text, image, and video)
• Knowledge of online marketing channels, some sort of funnels, and lead generation

• Excellent communication skills
• Analytical and multitasking skills
• Knows and knowledgeable with Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok

Job Title: Cold Call (Più sei bravo più guadagni) - Fisso + Bonus Prestazione. Solo persone Ambiziose
Description:
Cerco persone ambiziose, con minima esperienza per fare chiamate e prendere appuntamenti su liste fornite da noi (se non hai esperienza essere estroversi e con voglia di imparare basta) entrando a far parte del nostro team. Mentalità lungo termine.

Siamo il servizio di chiamate a freddo per agenzie n.1 in Italia. 

5 ore al giorno dal lunedì al venerdì, 500€ di fisso + 15-30€ ad appuntamento (dipende dal cliente con cui lavorerai)

Chi lavora con noi fa attualmente 1100-1600€ al mese con 25 ore alla settimana.

Requisiti: 1 telefono, 1 computer, 5 ore al giorno dal lunedì al venerdì, ambizione, voglia di migliorare e di fare.

Bisogna solo prendere un appuntamento per telefono suscitando curiosità. Forniamo script, formazione gratuita e liste di numeri. Impara una skill di alto livello guadagnando.

Job Title: German native: Looking for Cold Calling (Telemarketing) Professional
Description:
Hallo liebe UpWork Community, 

ich suche aktuell einen Cold Calling Professional.

Wir sind eine Online-Marketing Agentur namens "BookedoutDentist" (bookedoutdentist.de) die mit Zahnarztpraxen zusammenarbeitet und diese mehr Neupatienten über Google Maps in die Tür reinspielt. Unser Wachstum möchten wir nun mit Cold Calling ausbauen und anfeuern. 

Daher suche ich jemanden der bereits Erfahrung im Cold Calling hat und hier Spaß an der Akquise von Erstterminen hat. 

Ich habe eine Liste mit 4.000 Prospects die abtelefoniert werden sollen. 

Folgende Dinge sind vorhanden: 
1.) Ein Team das Ergebnisse am laufenden Ban produziert. Hier ein Kundenergebnis: https://youtu.be/pyppVm-6pws
2.) 100% Remote arbeiten
3.) Liste mit Prospects, die bereits 3-6 Cold E-Mails erhalten haben (sprich potenziell kennen Sie uns schon). 
2.) Sales Script ist vorhanden mit Einwandbehandlung.
3.) Ziel: Termine für Kennenlerngespräche legen. Link zu meinem Kalender ist vorhanden, sodass du die Interessenten direkt bei mir einbuchen kannst. 

Was du mitbringen musst:
1.) German Native - Wir arbeiten mit deutschsprachigen Zahnarztpraxen. 
2.) Erfahrungen im Sales und Skills im Telesales und Kommunikation
3.) Offene Persönlichkeit, die Bock auf Cold Calling hat. 
4.) 6-8 Stunden Zeit täglich zum telefonieren.
5.) Optional: Kenntnisse von Pipedrive.

Vergütung:
Die Vergütung erfolgt pro Stunde und Provision von 100€ pro wahrgenommen Termin. 

Melde dich gern und wir bereden alle Details. 

Ich freue mich auf unser Kennenlernen. 

Liebe Grüße aus Berlin
Moritz

Job Title: Marketing Pro to develop copy & layout for AI/Computer Vision Device and SaaS services
Description:
Our product is a fairly niche application with a lot of competition.  Often our clients are won through relationships and word of mouth rather than features and price, as these are both commoditized in the industry and often products are “very similar.”

We have a unique opportunity to direct-market to a huge client base of a well-known company in our industry, but one that does not offer the same products and services that we do.  Our product is complimentary to theirs, and they will distribute our marketing materials directly to their clients.

What we need – A skilled marketing pro that can spend time talking with us about our product, services, and specifically how they apply to this partner and their client base.  We’ll want you to gain a deep understanding about how our product is different, and how this can really help the potential customer base we will market to.  Interviews with some current clients for testimonials is also an option.

Once you understand the product, and how much it can help the potential customers, you’ll develop very targeted copy that will ring all the bells.  When they read it their only reaction will be, “I want this!”  Some basic layout options or direction will be very helpful that we can hand off to our graphic designer. 

This will be a one or two-pager, not really a brochure.  Something that the customer can open in their email, open the attachment, and get captivated by the possibilities we can offer them.

Our industry is public safety, law enforcement, covert, defense, and high-tech.  Examples of your previous work, or anything similar is highly encouraged with your proposal.  Ready to get started with the right person immediately.

We are seeking a highly experienced consultant to assist us in reviewing and optimizing our updated hiring process. Our goal is to attract top-notch talent, also known as "A players," for marketing positions to join our team.

Responsibilities:

- Thoroughly review our current hiring process, including job postings, candidate screening, interviewing, and onboarding.
- Provide recommendations for improvement, based on best practices and industry standards in a remote environment.
- Consult in developping a strategy for attracting and retaining high-profile candidates.
- On a later stage: Provide support and guidance to HR and hiring teams to implement the updated process.

Requirements:

- Proven experience as a consultant in the HR or recruitment field.
- In-depth knowledge of current hiring trends and best practices.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

If you are a talented and experienced consultant who is passionate about helping organizations attract top talent, we want to hear from you.

Thank you,

About Freecash:

Since its launch in 2020, Freecash has been one of the fastest-growing platforms that allow users to test a wide range of products, apps, websites, games, etc., and get rewarded. Freecash.com is an innovative platform that connects millions of consumers with brands. With 6.5M registered users and 750,000 active users monthly, we’re already a leader in the market.

You will take care of the following tasks

 As the Senior SEO Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing a comprehensive SEO strategy that aligns with the goals of the company.

You will identify KPIs related to SEO and monitor metrics such as redirects, click rate, and bounce rate.

  You will optimize website content and landing pages to improve search engine rankings and user experience.

 You will report on the results of your efforts on a bi-weekly basis to the marketing team.

  When problems arise, you will identify the issues and implement solutions to address them.

 You will continuously seek out ways to optimize processes and increase productivity.

 You will collect and analyze data to generate reports on traffic, rankings, and other relevant SEO metrics.

 In collaboration with the social media team, you will launch crossmedia campaigns.

You will stay up-to-date on the latest trends and best practices in SEO and integrated marketing.

 As the leader of the editorial team, you will be responsible for overseeing content marketing for the blog and managing a team of 20+ writers.

You will provide training and hold workshops for the writing team to enhance their skills.

 Your goal will be to help the company become the leading provider of offerwall websites in search results.

 You will perform audits of various types and address any pain points identified.

Using tools like SEMrush, Moz, and Screaming Frog, you will assess the organic search performance of the website and identify opportunities for improvement.

You will work towards achieving organic search revenue goals and create a strategy for it.

 You will create and lead initiatives to improve organic search ranking, visits, and revenue, with the aim of maximizing return on investment.

As a senior member of the team, you will direct and supervise major SEO activities, including tech audits, keyword research, and competitive research.

You will work with other departments to run and create AdSense Campaigns

You should:

You will be required to be based in Berlin and physically present in the office at least 3 days per week.

You should have a proven track record in SEO, with a minimum of 5 years of experience, including 3 years in a managerial role.

You should be comfortable and skilled at collaborating with other teams.

 Strong data literacy and the ability to translate data into actionable insights for the company are essential for this role.

 We are looking for someone who is a strategic thinker and able to understand the business impact of their decisions. You should also be hands-on and have a growth mindset.

We value candidates who are able to find creative solutions to technical challenges and demonstrate resilience.

 Experience working with complex marketing metrics and KPIs is preferred.

You should be a team player with excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and strong presentation and analytical skills.

Familiarity with basic tech/HTML for SEO purposes is desired.

A bachelor's degree, preferably in marketing or online marketing, is preferred.

Fluency in English is required.

What we offer:

We are a company that values our employees and offers a number of benefits to support their personal and professional growth. Some of the highlights include:

Flexible working hours: We understand that everyone has different commitments and responsibilities outside of work, and we are committed to supporting a healthy work-life balance

We offer a generous budget for activities that support the growth and development of your activities

Career growth opportunities and promotions: We believe in investing in our team and providing opportunities for advancement

 International team of passionate people: Our team is made up of talented individuals from all around the world, and we value the diversity of perspectives and experiences that everyone is bringing to the table

Culture driven by results: At our company, we are results-oriented and focused on delivering high-quality work

An awesome Office in the center of Berlin in a Co-Working space

A yearly salary range between $50,000-$60,000. Possibility on a Performance driven Bonus up to an additional 10.000$

Are you interested in this opportunity? If so, we would love to get to know you better and see if you might be a good fit for our team. Please send us your resume and cover letter, along with your availability and salary expectations. If you have any questions, you can reach out to Anthony, who will be happy to help you out.

Job Title: Mailgun Expert for Integration and Set Up Consultation
Description:
Hi! We’re FirstEditing and we’re looking for a Mailgum expert who can, as a first step, analyze our current email system and set up and provide advice on how we could migrate our newsletters and email to Mailgun.

We currently use our own email system which is a MySQL CRM with PHP, that we use to build all our newsletters and transactional emails. Although the templates themselves are being created in BeeFree and then we copy-paste the HTML into the system. We currently use Mailgun only for the delivery of emails. We have come to realize it’s not the most comfortable or user-friendly alternative for us.

- We would like to consider building our newsletter templates directly in Mailgun. 
- Being able to easily select the delivery list for the newsletters in Mailgun.
- Maybe even move the transactional emails and their automation to Mailgun.

But we need an expert since we’re not clear on how we could integrate Mailgun with the current system, or whether we need to migrate the emails lists to Mailgun, or whether we can connect through an API.

Let us a bit about your experience and how you could help us with this.

Thank you!

Job Title: Experienced YouTube Ads Media Buyer For Remodeling Businesses
Description:
Compensation: $600 - $1,000 /month /client
Location: Virtual/anywhere

We run a specialized marketing agency called GB Renaissance, helping remodeling businesses to get more leads, appointments, and clients with YouTube ads. While most other marketing agencies help everybody with everything, we’ve only focused on YouTube ads for remodeling businesses. This gives us a competitive advantage, and our clients love it.


About the Job:
We’re looking for a rockstar YouTube ads manager to work with us and deliver outstanding results to our clients. As our YouTube ads manager, you will work with us on per client basis and be responsible for the following tasks:
*Setting up and launching YouTube campaigns
*Setting up retargeting pixels, custom conversions, etc. *Daily management of YouTube campaigns once they go live *Build & A/B test high-converting landing pages.


Requirements:
As the title says, we’re looking for an experienced YouTube ads manager for remodeling businesses, and this doesn’t mean anybody. You must satisfy all of the following requirements to be considered for this job:
*Experience setting up, launching, and managing effective YouTube campaigns for remodeling companies.
*Proven track record that you’re able to prove
*Knowledge of landing pages, funnels, conversions, testing, etc.
*Ability to check on client campaigns and report results into a Google Spreadsheet daily.
*Having experience with HighLevel is a big plus.


How to Apply:
To apply for this job, please send over a brief 1-2 minute loom video about why you believe this job is for you. Please confirm that you meet all the requirements and send as much proof as possible to back it up. Finally, why should we hire you over all the other applicants?

Job Title: White Hat Linkbuilding via E-Mail Outreach
Description:
We run a word search engine designed for a versatile scope of usages. Students can find synonyms and antonyms for their research papers and degree theses. Puzzle enthusiasts can search for Scrabble and crossword puzzle solutions, and our word finder locates English words according to user-specified criteria, such as the first or last letter of a word.

Now we are looking for a white hat linkbuilding expert. We can create any kind of new content that you need in order to create linkbuilding campaigns.

It should be manual e-mail outreach campaigns. We have the ability to create content / graphics etc. that will help you with link building. So if you have ideas for a link campaign, we can create the article needed for it, which will serve for linking.

We are NOT looking for PBNs, paid links, Forums, Blog Comments, spamy links in general etc. Only high quality links with manual link outreach.

We do NOT need any other seo consulting or onpage consulting. This job is exclusively about building high quality backlinks.

Please let us know your references.

Description:
We are looking for an experienced market researcher to help us better understand our target audience and competitors in the iPhone accessories market. The ideal candidate should have experience in conducting website analysis, utilizing digital platforms, and creating comprehensive SWOT analysis.

Responsibilities:

Conduct a thorough analysis of competitor websites, including the identification of key marketing strategies, product offerings, and target demographics - (tools used on their website, similarweb analysis).

Utilize digital platforms such as SimilarWeb, Meta, TikTok, and YouTube to gather data on market trends, consumer behavior, and competitor activity.

Create a SWOT analysis of the market, including the identification of strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats.

Analyze the target demographics of competitors and identify the countries they are focusing on.

Provide recommendations for improving our marketing strategy and targeting efforts based on the insights gathered from the research.

Requirements:

Proven experience as a market researcher, with a focus on digital platforms and website analysis.

Strong analytical skills, with the ability to identify key trends and patterns in data.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present findings in a clear and concise manner.

Familiarity with market research tools and techniques, such as surveys, focus groups, and secondary research.

Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

If you are a talented market researcher with a passion for iPhone accessories and a proven track record of delivering high-quality results, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a cover letter to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Description:
Hi! We are a small company exclusively distributing a product called Thermomix in Sweden. Thermomix is a kitchen robot that also cooks! It’s amazing! :) Check it up at thermomix.se

Thermomix is brutally popular in countries like France, Germany, Spain or Italy. But not so much in Sweden. So we believe there is a huge business opportunity.

We started the business 4 years ago and we’re doing fairly well, addressing many marketing channels, although the influencers part has never been properly covered.

We are steadily growing, but mainly among expat communities, where Thermomix is brutally popular. We think well chosen Influencers might help us grow among Swedes in a way we cn afford.

To be frank, when we’ve tried with influencers it’s never worked: lack of chemistry with them, not choosing the right ones for our target groups, not knowing what to ask in return them to donfor js, bad follow up of the deliveries, bad retribution negotiation,… A mess.

But we think influencers is a key missing piece in our strategy.
We’re ready to investigate this field, but we need to start small testing if there is return in the investment. But starting small: we’re a profitable business, but a small one with limited financial resources. Obviously.

We need a Swedish expert to assess us and to execute this strategy. We’re ready to pay a fee  for you + the influencer costs. But we’re ready to discuss the best way to pay for your services. We’re open to ideas.

Can you help us building one understanding our financial constraints?

Job Title: Market research expert to conduct Rebrand research study
Description:
We are a DTC brand that is about to rebrand as we graduate. 

Our brand naturalpatch.com has been around 3 years and here is why we are rebranding.

1. Our business equity and valuation is not just revenue, but will be brand. Need to be defensible. 
2. It's still immature, packaging and website perform, but are not consistent, don't tell a cohesive story, people don't know what we stand for
3. Need to level up, bold, especially for retail. 
4. We have a collection of products (sleepypatch, allergypatch, buzzpatch) but we're known for BuzzPatch. That's a product brand. Like Unilver having Dove, Lynx, Ben & Jerry's, Rexona. We don't want to invest in building a house of brands. We want a brand, with multiple product lines. All tied together.

1. We hired a globally renowned brand strategist (ex Global Director of Brand for Uber) to help us figure out what the brand could be (Strategy). We interviewed brand agencies, about 15 of them, but decided to split out the work - strategy and design/voice identity. Whole lot of reasons we did this, notably, wanted best strategist for the job, wanted best creative for the job. Hard to find a shop with both.

He worked for 4 months interviewing us founders, customers, considering the market, the gap, where we can be bold and stand out - to distiI our values, mission, territories, voice, wants, emotions, etc etc. 

Fundamentally we distilled that we "playfully solve life's problems" and that we are solving parent anxiety, not the actual issue. Ie, we're not solving sleep for kids. We're solving parents worried about not getting "me time" at night. We're not worried about mosquitoes, we're solving parents anxiety in dealing with grumpy kids itching all over. And so on.

We need to lean into that, celebrate parents for their incredible juggling act, and show them we're here, we get them, we are one of them, and we want to take one thing off their plate. Naturally, safely, simply.

The brief was to make something bold, a bit uncomfortable (like a song you don't love initially but becomes a legend vs a song you love instantly and forget in 5 minutes). Something that could own the category, be defensible, un-copyable, be lovable for kids, lovable for parents.

2. Find and brief a design shop (he interviewed 9 design houses, and 7 tone of voice/verbal houses) based on the experience of DTC, retail, parent/kid related brand.

They needed to get what we were trying to achieve.

We have the output of the rebrand which we love, but before we sign off, we want to conduct some research. 

We don’t know what research we need, both to identify things people love about our current brand, and then to get feelings around our new brand.

We need someone with brand research expertise to:
1. Guide us on what research to do 
2. Help us recruit (we have 500k customers in different geographies with different NPS ranges we can recruit)
3. Design the research surveys
4. Prepare the report with feedback and take aways

Job Title: Social Media Marketing Manager

We are seeking a highly motivated and organized Social Media Marketing Manager to join our team. As a key member of our marketing team, the successful candidate will be responsible for creating and executing social media marketing strategies for our clients, managing multiple projects, and building brands through engaging content and campaigns.

This position will entail a weekly workload of 10-15 hours initially, working with just one client. However, once you have proven your ability to effectively handle a single client, your hours will gradually increase until they reach a maximum of 40 hours per week. We are constantly acquiring new clients, and as such, we require someone who can create a comprehensive social media audit and strategy to incorporate into their proposals for prospective clients.

Key Responsibilities:

    Develop and implement social media marketing strategies for multiple clients that align with their overall business goals and objectives
    Create, curate, and manage engaging and relevant content for social media platforms, including Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn
    Collaborate with clients and internal teams to develop and execute campaigns that drive engagement and build brand awareness
    Analyze and report on the performance of social media campaigns, making recommendations for improvements and optimizations
    Stay up-to-date with the latest social media trends and technologies, and share insights with the team to inform strategy and decision-making
    Manage multiple projects and campaigns simultaneously, ensuring deadlines are met and deliverables are of the highest quality

Qualifications:

    Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field
    3+ years of experience in social media marketing, with a proven track record of success in managing multiple projects and building brands
    Excellent writing and communication skills, with the ability to create compelling content that engages audiences
    Strong understanding of social media platforms, including Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn
    Ability to analyze and interpret social media data, and use insights to inform strategy and decision-making
    Excellent project management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively
    A team player with a positive attitude and a passion for marketing and brand building

Job Title: Outsource Call Center Search - projects area of responsibility: portugal
Description:
JOB OFFER - Outsource Call Center Search - projects area of responsibility: Portugal

Help us find a call Center 

We are searching for call centers all around the world for a long term collaboration. Requirements are simple - they should be able to call to portugal and should not have like a strong foreign accent. So best case are call centers who offer the languages spoken in the mentioned countries. Second requirement is we offer just a commission based model only. Further informations in the project briefing below. 

A short summary what the collaboration for the Call Centers would be about:

It's about the truck cartel (all big truck companies) & diesel emissions scandal - The Call centers specific task is about helping/informing companies in Europe (including all Balkan countries + Turkey + UK) that they get compensation for a period of 20 years during which they bought/rented/leased trucks and cars. In that period the prices have been manipulated form the truck cartel.

The amount in dispute is now around 1.8 billion Euros, of which the call centers could receive a commission by simple informing our leads about their compensation. The great part is it is no selling, it is just informing the company. The companies themselves have zero costs and zero risks. 

We are working with 3 major companies - law firm in Munich, process pre-financier (private equity investment company from the US) and the consumer protection, on whose behalf we will act.

We already prepared a full back office with tracking, CRM and all leads, PDFs, training videos, scripts and onboarding for the call centers. Furthermore, in order to get all data, details and insights including documents of the legal decisions, an NDA has to be signed of the Call centers CEO or Director during the onboarding process. Contracts etc. will also be prepared for the Call centers CEO or Director and given to them during the process. The representative will be the only person who gets onboarded and he will manage all leads and allocate them to the call centers agents. 

You can give the call centers a quick example of how their work will look like. They will call one of our leads and just inform them of the compensation they are entitled to receive for all trucks and cars purchased/leased/rented between 1998 - 2018. For example, if the company purchased 1,000 trucks and 100 cars, with just this one lead they would receive 10 euros/truck = 10,000 euros plus 10euros/car = 1.000 euros. In average they gonna ‚close‘ 60 trucks per hour. So they can calculate their approximate commissions themselves.

They will get tens of thousands of high quality leads from us (in total we have 17 million leads that can be allocated). We think this would be very very lucrative for anyone, so that’s why we offer a commission based model only (if they are not working on commission only, please let us know right away - in that case we cannot work with them for now). Commissions are paid out within 2-4 weeks and runs automatically through their own back office. 

If a commission based model holds them back from working with us - you can offer them something else. Let's say we work with one of their agents for a week or two as a free trial phase. They can test everything, they get some of our highly qualified leads and see if it works for their company. If the trial weeks went well, they probably already made a few thousand euros. After this trial period, they can decide whether or not we want to continue with a pure commission-based model. So they can't really lose anything and they have minimal risk, except some time it takes for just one of their agents. 

If you are interested and want to know more details, please contact me as soon as possible.

I would be happy to welcome some call centers on board soon.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

In average they gonna ‚close‘ 60 trucks per hour. So they can calculate their approximate commissions themselves.

They will get tens of thousands of high quality leads from us (in total we have 17 million leads that can be allocated). We think this would be very very lucrative for anyone, so that’s why we offer a commission based model only (if they are not working on commission only, please let us know right away - in that case we cannot work with them for now). Commissions are paid out within 2-4 weeks and runs automatically through their own back office. 

If a commission based model holds them back from working with us - you can offer them something else. Let's say we work with one of their agents for a week or two as a free trial phase. They can test everything, they get some of our highly qualified leads and see if it works for their company. If the trial weeks went well, they probably already made a few thousand euros. After this trial period, they can decide whether or not we want to continue with a pure commission-based model. So they can't really lose anything and they have minimal risk, except some time it takes for just one of their agents. 

If you are interested and want to know more details, please contact me as soon as possible.

I would be happy to welcome some call centers on board soon.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Description:
JOB OFFER - Outsource Call Center Search - projects area of responsibility: France

Help us find a call Center 

We are searching for call centers all around the world for a long term collaboration. Requirements are simple - they should be able to call to France and should not have like a strong foreign accent. So best case are call centers who offer the languages spoken in the mentioned countries. Second requirement is we offer just a commission based model only. Further informations in the project briefing below. 

A short summary what the collaboration for the Call Centers would be about:

It's about the truck cartel (all big truck companies) & diesel emissions scandal - The Call centers specific task is about helping/informing companies in Europe (including all Balkan countries + Turkey + UK) that they get compensation for a period of 20 years during which they bought/rented/leased trucks and cars. In that period the prices have been manipulated form the truck cartel.

The amount in dispute is now around 1.8 billion Euros, of which the call centers could receive a commission by simple informing our leads about their compensation. The great part is it is no selling, it is just informing the company. The companies themselves have zero costs and zero risks. 

We are working with 3 major companies - law firm in Munich, process pre-financier (private equity investment company from the US) and the consumer protection, on whose behalf we will act.

We already prepared a full back office with tracking, CRM and all leads, PDFs, training videos, scripts and onboarding for the call centers. Furthermore, in order to get all data, details and insights including documents of the legal decisions, an NDA has to be signed of the Call centers CEO or Director during the onboarding process. Contracts etc. will also be prepared for the Call centers CEO or Director and given to them during the process. The representative will be the only person who gets onboarded and he will manage all leads and allocate them to the call centers agents. 

You can give the call centers a quick example of how their work will look like. They will call one of our leads and just inform them of the compensation they are entitled to receive for all trucks and cars purchased/leased/rented between 1998 - 2018. For example, if the company purchased 1,000 trucks and 100 cars, with just this one lead they would receive 10 euros/truck = 10,000 euros plus 10euros/car = 1.000 euros. In average they gonna ‚close‘ 60 trucks per hour. So they can calculate their approximate commissions themselves.

They will get tens of thousands of high quality leads from us (in total we have 17 million leads that can be allocated). We think this would be very very lucrative for anyone, so that’s why we offer a commission based model only (if they are not working on commission only, please let us know right away - in that case we cannot work with them for now). Commissions are paid out within 2-4 weeks and runs automatically through their own back office. 

If a commission based model holds them back from working with us - you can offer them something else. Let's say we work with one of their agents for a week or two as a free trial phase. They can test everything, they get some of our highly qualified leads and see if it works for their company. If the trial weeks went well, they probably already made a few thousand euros. After this trial period, they can decide whether or not we want to continue with a pure commission-based model. So they can't really lose anything and they have minimal risk, except some time it takes for just one of their agents. 

If you are interested and want to know more details, please contact me as soon as possible.

Job Title: Website SEO optimization to improve rankings and traffic on search engines..
Description:
Job Needs

• Add website description (metatag: description). To improve the 1 ranking and presentation of the website in search engines
 
• Add keywords (metatag: keywords) to impact 2 on the ranking and presentation of the page in search engines!
 
o Properly optimized meta tags should give users as much information as possible about the content of the website so that it is easier for browsers to index it, and thus raise their search ranking.
 
• Fix IMG tags in the code without the ALT tag, that can significantly affect 3 the indexing of content by search engines
 
• Add keyword phrase saturation that significant 4 impact on the low rankings in search engines!
 
• Add internal links in the website's content related to the main keywords, to improve the page's ranking!
 
o Make the above changes to the website’s content and code so that its content is understandable to search engines and can gain higher rankings.
 
• Correct search engine blocking (disallow) phrases in the robots.txt file, this 6 may have a negative impact on Google indexing your content
 
• Add Google Analytics tool to the website code, to Google’s ranking.
 
• Add Google Search Console to the website code, to improve ranking in Google.
 
• Correct errors on the website that may cause the website to be downgraded by Google or even banned from searches. Install Google analytical tools may also to improve website’s position in the ranking.

Job Title: Press, Events and Joint Venture Management
Description:
Working across two companies - Iron Cage and High Priestess (www.HighPriestess.com.au), we're looking for someone to manage media opportunities, Joint Ventures and our in-person events. 

Iron Cage is a cutting edge technology company working in the B2B sales intelligence space. 

High Priestess is Australia's largest Witchcraft Supply and Education portal (B2C). 

Leela Cosgrove is the CEO of both company's (www.leelacosgrove.com) - in working across strategically growing both of these businesses, her personal brand falls a bit by the wayside.  She is currently managing her own media and joint venture opportunities.

Gulliver Giles is the Director and head of client management and training for Iron Cage. Gulliver is well known in his industry for his dynamic presentation style, and a crucial part of Iron Cage's growth plan for 2023 is to see Gulliver speak on more stages. 

The duties we see in this role would be:

* Working with Leela and Gulliver on creating strategic marketing plans both for their personal brands and for the two company's. 

* Reaching out to media outlets. 

* Reaching out to potential Joint Venture partners (L & G are killer sales people - they're very happy to help close the deals if someone can set them up!). 

* Helping with the organisation of public events (current events on our schedule include: Witch School, the Women's Leadershp Festival, and multiple events for the Dell Women's Entrepreneur Network, which Leela is the Australian Chapter Leader of).

But we are REALLY open to you bringing ideas and feedback. 

We're specifically looking for someone with a lot of experience in these areas - we're open to higher payrates commesurate with experience. 

See, we had a conversation about training one of our current team in doing the basics - but Leela strongly felt that what we want is to bring in someone with expertise we don't have in house.

While Leela is a 15 year veteran of Digital and Social Marketing, she's aware that the focus has always been on building the company, and not her personal brand. 

Now, we're looking to work on building all four brands at once. Iron Cage, High Priestess, Leela Cosgrove and Gulliver Giles. 

We like to hire professionals and then TRUST them - so the wage and the hours we've set are a guess, and we're open to being directed to see things differently. 

We're a 100% remote company, but we do try and touch base quarterly in-person with our team in Melbourne, and it would be great to have someone who could be physically present at our larger events - so our ideal situation would be someone either Melbourne based, or someone who travels to Melbourne regularly. 

That said, our #1 Priority is to get the BEST possible person - so if that's someone based in the US, we'll make it work. 

We're happy to look at freelancers or agencies - and are open as to whether this stays as a contracting job or moves to full time.

Develop and execute a comprehensive marketing strategy to drive user acquisition and engagement

Collaborate with the product and development teams to create and distribute marketing content such as blog posts, social media updates, and email campaigns

Manage and grow our social media presence across multiple platforms

Continuously measure and analyze the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and adjust strategies accordingly

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a remote team

Description:
Hello candidate,

We need a couple of professional sales development associates (or specialists) that will use our provided lead contact list to cold call, prospect, nurture leads and identify hot leads to set quality appointments for our local sales reps to meet with, and to close the deals.

The ideal candidate would be experienced in cold calling, lead nurturing, and email campaigns, and have a very persuasive telemarketer personality.

We require continuous quality appointment setting, where the set appointment is an onsite in-person appointment for our sales rep to meet with the prospective client for a discovery meeting, which has at least one decision maker in attendance, and where the prospective client has an immediate need.

Starting in March, our target is to schedule 5-10 meetings per month and close a minimum of 6 new clients per month. 

In return for successful outcomes, we offer commissions on closed deals that you set appointments for, increased wages, and an opportunity for an extension of work term with our company, 

We provide lead contact lists, cold-calling scripts, and any marketing materials that you may require for your ongoing tasks.

This project is not for everyone and you should ideally be highly skilled and able to communicate effectively and ultimately deliver. 

You will be the guy/girl who will create something amazing for the Australian business market. Be part of something exciting that will lead to bigger things.

Develop, implement, and manage PPC campaigns across multiple platforms, including Google Ads, Bing Ads, and social media advertising

Requirements:
2+ years of experience in PPC advertising

Strong analytical skills, with the ability to use data to inform decision making and drive performance improvements
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

We offer a dynamic and fast-paced work environment, with opportunities for growth and professional development. If you're a data-driven marketer with a passion for driving results, we'd love to hear from you!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Role:  Conference & Event Coordinator, Marketing

Description:
Wayfinder is a small K-12 start-up focused on enabling students with the skills and tools they need to thrive in academics, career, and life. We have a young marketing team eager to learn and grow to meet our goals. 

We are currently looking for a contract Marketing Event Coordinator to serve as the internal and external point person for the 30+ conferences and events we plan to attend and/or host in 2023. This person will be an integral part of our team, owning a high ROI channel of our marketing strategy. Depending on the season, we anticipate the role will have 15-30 hrs/per week of work. We are currently in the “high” season with an anticipated 25-30 hours per week for the next two months at least.

Roles & Responsibilities
+Learn and understand the K-12 education event space and use this knowledge to maximize the ROI of selected events
+Manage the end-to-end conference process from planning, execution, and post-mortem.
+Partner with other members of the Wayfinder marketing team to build awareness and drive attendance to each activation
+Research + book spaces for external events that meet brand expectations and budget allocation, such as: happy hours, networking events, dinners, regional informational sessions
+Coordinate logistics for all events, including: shipping booth kits to arrive on time and on budget, instructing post-conference shipping plans, booking accommodations for guest speakers, registering team members for events, etc.
+Coordinate conference booth needs with conference vendors and other external service providers (Ex:  ordering carpet, lead scanners, electricity, etc.)
Identify, design, and deploy collateral pieces (brochures, branded items, etc) for each event, both existing and new.
+Hold regularly scheduled check-in meetings with internal Wayfinder team


Project Timeline:
Ongoing

Rate:
The rate for this project is $15-$40/hr.

Job Title: Email Marketing and Lead Generation Help
Description:
I own a successful research transcription company (so think qualitative focus groups, interviews, etc. Not medical records).  Frankly, we haven't done any sales work in over ten years.  We provide an incredibly high quality process and product and our growth has been via word of mouth.

I'd now like to see what lead generation and email marketing can do for me.  I'd need someone to come forward with an actual plan, and some form of an overall estimate and timeline.  

I have no problem writing the emails myself, and frankly, I can use something like constant contact to send them and buy email addresses.  

What I'm here to find out is... is there more to it?  Is there something more that a professional like one of you can offer me?  

So please... teach me!!  Tell me your ideas!

Job Title: YouTube SEO Specialist/ Video Editing a Plus!
Description:
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled YouTube SEO Specialist to join our team. The successful candidate will have a passion for YouTube and digital marketing, as well as a strong understanding of search engine optimization (SEO) and how to apply it to YouTube videos. In this role, you will be responsible for optimizing our YouTube videos to increase visibility and drive traffic to our channel.

Responsibilities:
-Conduct in-depth keyword research to determine the most relevant keywords for our videos
-Optimize video titles, descriptions, tags, and captions to increase visibility and rankings on YouTube and Google search
-Monitor and analyze our YouTube channel performance, making recommendations for improvement based on data
-Collaborate with our content team to ensure that all videos are optimized for SEO and meet YouTube's best practices
-Stay up-to-date on the latest YouTube and SEO trends and algorithms, and implement them as needed
-Provide monthly reporting on channel performance, including metrics such as views, subscribers, and engagement

Requirements:
-2+ years of experience in YouTube SEO and digital marketing
-Strong understanding of YouTube's algorithm and best practices for optimizing videos for search
-Experience with keyword research tools and analyzing YouTube channel performance data
-Excellent writing and communication skills, with the ability to craft compelling video titles, descriptions, and tags
-Familiarity with Google Analytics and Google Search Console
-Self-starter with the ability to work independently in a remote environment

We offer a competitive salary, a fun and dynamic work environment, and the opportunity to work with a talented and passionate team. If you're passionate about YouTube and SEO and want to help us grow our channel, we'd love to hear from you!

Job Title: Facebook/Google/ Bing PPC Lead Generation for Orthodontists (Braces/Invisalign)
Description:
Hello,
I am the founder and CEO of Orcus Marketing, a lead generation agency for orthodontists. The services we offer are PPC Ad Campaign management for Facebook, as well as Google/Bing, and I am looking for specialists who can provide the quality that my clients expect. If the following terms are fitting, please do not hesitate to connect with me and we can discuss next steps!

NOTE: I am looking to build a team, so only apply if you can be fully committed.

Basic Requirements:

- Must have excellent written and verbal English Skills 
- Can be from anywhere in the world (South America, Africa, Asia preferred)
- Must have excellent presentation skills
- Must have at least 5 years of experience with online marketing
- Must be specialized in Facebook and Google PPC (Bing too would be preferred)
- Must have results and past campaigns ready to show
- Must have experience in the dental niche (Orthodontist Preferred)
- Visual intelligence; understanding of graphic design principles
- Hands-on experience with tools like Google Analytics
- Experience with B2C Lead Generation
- Freelancers only (No agencies)

Benefits:
- Full Time Work from Home (Anywhere In the World)
- Paid per client worked with (How much you earn depends on you)
- $333 per month, per client (3 clients p/m = $999p/m, etc.) or hourly pay [TBD]
- Flexible Paid Time Off
- Birthday Time Off
- Company Holidays
- Professional Training, simple process

Responsibilities (may be but are not limited to...) :
- Setup and run campaigns and strategies for clients
- Build campaign calendars for clients based on data
- Assess against ROAS and KPIs to develop an ongoing profitable strategy
- Deep dive into Google and Facebook analytics to provide a high-level strategy for clients 
- Make sure all ad campaigns are tracking on budget
- Daily campaign optimization
- Continual rotation of fresh ads, offers, and content
- Build out a solid sales funnel for ad campaigns
- Spearhead efforts to reduce marketing spend and increase profitability
- Meet quick deadlines in a fast-paced work environment
- Report client results to management on a bi-weekly basis 
- Come up with complex and "out of the box" marketing campaigns that are unique for the client
- Come up with and implement profitable lead generation campaigns that are not giveaways
- Set up discounts as needed
- Attend weekly (or bi-weekly) meetings
- We promise to give our clients at least 10 consultations per month, so quality is expected

Job Title: In-House SEO for Link Building Focused SEO Agency
Description:
Hi!

We run a fully remote link building focused SEO agency (linkflow.ai) focused on B2B Tech and SaaS clients and are looking for an SEO ninja to help improve our client results. We do both link building work and full SEO consulting. We do not need someone to go out and build links, we already do that in house. 

We are an exciting, fast growing company with ample opportunity for advancement and long-term compensation potential for someone who's great at the role and a good fit with our culture (fun, driven, entrepreneurial).

This is a part-time role with the potential to turn into full-time for the right person. We're looking for someone with experience creating strong results for national (non-local) businesses, and ideally experience as an in-house SEO. Our client companies are not local, so we are not looking for someone who’s a local SEO expert.

This role will start out at roughly 10-20 hours per week, with the potential for more hours and even full time, if it makes sense for both of us. 

**Prior to an interview, selected candidates will be required to complete an SEO assessment and submit a short video explaining the rationale for your recommendations.

Responsibilities:

-Determining effective SEO strategies for our clients and setting goals around keywords, pages, rankings

-Taking the lead on SEO consulting projects for clients (this means creating a plan, assisting the clients in executing the plan and fielding questions regarding it)

-Taking the lead role on performing “SEO Roadmaps” for clients (a detailed SEO audit and strategy)

-Quarterly reporting back to clients on the progress we’ve made on our SEO goals as well as identifying potential areas for improvement

-Communicating client details to our link operations team on Slack & Google Sheets regarding anchor text selection and pages to build links to

-Improving our own SEO (for our agency, Linkflow)

-Assisting our Sales Reps on the closing of sales when needed

Expectations:

-Be active on our Slack channel and fairly responsive - doesn’t have to be immediate, but ideally you can reply within a couple of hours.

-Join us on a regularly scheduled weekly meeting

-Occasionally email directly with our clients regarding SEO strategy, or on phone/Zoom calls as needed to explain things to them. 

-Hours don’t have to be strictly within 9-5, but availability during the normal working hours is ideal.

-Occasionally hop on calls with prospects to help explain SEO concepts to them

-Be professional and kick ass at SEO (No scrubs!)

Skills/Experience we’re looking for:

-At least 3 years of in-house SEO experience, ideally for a national (non-local) business

-We are looking for someone who truly loves SEO, stays on top of trends in the industry, etc.

-Excellent understanding of overall SEO - both on-page and off-page, and proven experience getting results for clients

-Solid understanding of link building, anchor text selection - this is a huge part of what we do

-Knowledge of GSC, GA, relevant SEO tools especially Ahrefs (we use that one a lot)

-Excellent communication skills and attention to detail

-Gets things done on time (if you say X will be good to go on Thursday, it gets done on Thursday)

-Authoritative when speaking about SEO. We want our clients to listen to you and immediately trust what you have to say.

Attributes we’re looking for:

-Think proactively to improve processes

-Ability to talk intelligently and convincingly in front of clients

-Always looking to learn and improve your SEO skills

-A solid understanding of link building and how it works

-Think proactively for ways to improve our client results, and potentially help turn existing link building clients into SEO consulting clients

-Friendly

-Roll up your sleeves and dig in mentality

Pay: 
-$50/hr to start, with potential raise at the 3-month mark upon good performance
-Generous commissions on top of base hourly pay

Perks:
-Flexible hours that work for your schedule (so long as you can make the regular meetings)
-Ample opportunity for advancement within the company
-Full access to Gotch SEO academy training program and community at our expense
-Fun and friendly team 
-Bosses who aren't micro-managers - as long as you get your sh*t done well, we’re happy!

If this sounds like a good fit, reply and we'll take it from there!

Thanks,
Josh

Job Title: Customer Analyst for Credit Card Processing
Description:
Our company, Kairos Equities, is seeking a highly skilled Customer Analyst to help us understand the different customer segments in the credit card processing industry and what factors influence their decision-making process. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of market research methods and be able to provide insights and recommendations based on their analysis.

Responsibilities:

Conduct market research to understand the different customer segments in the credit card processing industry

Analyze customer data to identify trends, patterns, and insights

Develop detailed customer profiles, including information on their demographics, buying habits, and pain points

Evaluate the market positioning of our company and identify opportunities for improvement

Identify different customer segments in the credit card processing industry and what makes them switch
Investigate the factors that influence business owners' decision-making process when choosing a credit card processing company

Estimate the customer lifetime value for each customer segment

Analyze the switching rates between credit card processors for each customer segment

Provide recommendations for our company's marketing and sales strategy based on the findings of the customer analysis

Deliverables:

A comprehensive PowerPoint presentation outlining the findings of the customer analysis, including a summary of the different customer segments and what makes them switch, an analysis of the factors that influence business owners' decision-making process, estimates of customer lifetime value and switching rates, and recommendations for marketing and sales strategy

Requirements:

5+ years of experience in market research and customer analysis
Strong understanding of market research methods and data analysis techniques
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to produce high-quality, data-driven presentations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your proposal including your relevant experience and qualifications, along with samples of your previous work. We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Title: Small professional looking landing page for consulting business
Description:
I'm looking for a very experienced designer for a very small job - one page long website for a newly formed consulting company. The page should be simple, but very well thought through and look professional. 

Here is the draft of the page with the texts:  
https://nbseconsultingcom-23525916.hubspotpagebuilder.com/nbse-consulting 

Few nuances to note: 

1. Most likely, people would get there through a referral - someone is going to recommend the company to a friend through a personal connection. Most of the visitors would either know me (the founder) personally, or they were recommended to work with me through someone who knows me personally. 

2. The target audience consists of the department managers from marketing operations, sales operations, or finance operations, primarily working for companies having between 300 and 1500 employees. In other words, the audience is very "hands on", they know the tools they work with and the exact problems they need to solve, so we should be specific in what we do, as opposed to writing general words about "increasing the revenue and ROI".

3.  The first goal of the page is to specify the targeting.  From the very first sight the users should see what kind of consulting we provide and see that we are doing exactly what they struggle with (see the teams, the processes, and the tools from the draft page)

4. The second goal of the page is to establish credibility. The business is new and there aren't many customers we can already put there. Due to that, we want to establish the credibility through the personal experience of the founder (me) . I have collected recommendations from people I worked with in some well known companies in the industry (Wrike, Asana, Meta) and we need to put it on the website, so that people can see my personal experience and through that trust the company. 

5. I've put the draft of the text, but I'd love to hear your feedback on how to make it better, keeping in mind the two goals - clear targeting and credibility.

6. The website doesn't need to be unique and one of kind, we won't really be closing deals through it. It just needs to look simple and professional, so that it can reenforce the idea that clients will get good quality work from our company. 

7. As a company we are also working on a product, for which we already have the website. Ideally, the company's website should have a somewhat similar style to the product's website (https://document-engine.io/). It doesn't have to be identical, but somewhat similar. 

8. The outcome of this project should be the mock-up. If you can also actually build the page on squarespace, wix, tilda, wordpress, etc - I'd be happy to give you that project as well (we'll negotiate that separately). 


Ideally I'd love to find a designer who has done websites for consulting businesses before and can recommend me how to do it right. 

I have some small design related projects from time to time, it would be amazing to find someone for the long term partnership. 

Thank you and please let me know if you have any questions!

In order to gauge whether or not you read this description, please mention the word "cake" in your response. We are looking for SEOs that I can work with IMMEDIATELY on a long-term basis and are able to work 30+ hours per week.

Finally, please take a couple of minutes to answer the following questions:

1) What's your background with SEO?
2) How did you get into doing SEO?
3) What's your interest and familiarity with mental health-related topics?
4) What's your interest and familiarity with relationship-related topics?
5) Do you have access to Microsoft Word?
6) What is your process for ensuring your SEO strategy is correct and error-free?
7) How soon can you start?
8) Please provide examples of keywords you’ve directly contributed to them improving their ranking.
9) What SEO accomplishment are you most proud of and why?
10) Why are you interested in this project?
11) Why are you an ideal candidate for this project?
BONUS: 12) Which 3 numbers did the Chicago Bulls retire for Kobe Bryant?

Please note that a cover letter is NOT required, even though the job posting will ask for one.

Thanks for your time and interest.

Job Title: Competitive Analysis and Affiliate Partner Research for Credit Card Processing Industry
Description:
Kairos Equities is a consulting firm that is expanding into the credit card processing industry. We are seeking a research specialist to help us understand the competitive landscape and identify potential affiliate partners. The ideal candidate will have experience in market research and a deep understanding of the credit card processing industry.

Responsibilities:
Part 1: Standard Competitive Analysis

Conduct research on the credit card processing industry, including market trends, key players, and current market share

Analyze the strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats of key competitors

Develop detailed profiles of key competitors, including information on their products, services, target markets, and marketing strategies

Evaluate the market positioning of each competitor and identify opportunities for differentiation and improvement

Provide recommendations for our company's strategy based on the findings of the competitive analysis

Part 2: List of Affiliate Partners and Offerings in Credit Card Processing

Identify at least 25-50 potential affiliate partners that align with our company's target market and product offerings

Evaluate the reputation and credibility of potential affiliate partners

Identify unique features or offerings of each affiliate partner

If possible, outline the residuals offered to affiliates by each partner

Develop a comprehensive list of potential affiliate partners, including multiple points of contact information and relevant details about their business

Provide recommendations for the next steps, based on the research findings

*If could find a few that are based in Austin or Dallas that would be a Bonus*

Deliverables:

A PowerPoint presentation outlining the findings of the competitive analysis and affiliate partner research, including:

Key insights on the credit card processing industry
Detailed profiles of key competitors
Market positioning of each competitor and opportunities for differentiation
A comprehensive list of potential affiliate partners, with contact information and relevant details
Recommendations for our company's strategy and next steps

Requirements:

3+ years of experience in market research and partner sourcing
Strong understanding of the credit card processing industry and market trends
Excellent research, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Ability to produce high-quality, data-driven reports and presentations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proficiency in creating visually appealing and informative PowerPoint presentations


If you are a motivated and experienced research specialist with a passion for uncovering new opportunities in the credit card processing industry, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and qualifications.
